Reviews.Title: “Yes it was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: couple1091
Reviews.Content: Great time at Las Palapas. We did not like the first room (48) and got another (15) the next day. Good service, good breakfast, nice people. Other guests nice people, no noisy all inclusive crap. Most important: the absolute unique experience of having a room in the middle of a beautiful botanic garden, steps from the beach or on it, with your own veranda and hammocks. Rooms are a bit dated but well cleaned and everything's there. Absolute great value for money. No tv, hooray. Location of the hotel is good: Best beach of Playa, quiet end of Av Quinta. Neighboring Beachclub Mamitas does make noise, but not often en not long and not late. Being woken up by the birds is a plus.... Special thanks to the nice girls at reception.

Reviews.Title: “The best section of sand in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Robin P
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this resort based solely on tripadvisor reviews and I'm so glad we did. The property is lovely. There was a mistake with our room upon check-in so Mariela upgraded us from a Garden View lower-level room to an individual bungalow on the beach. Please do yourself a favor and spend the extra money and stay on the beach! The room was just stunning and we were literally steps from the water. After spending the day on the beach, we relaxed in our hammocks listening to the ocean waves roll in as the sun set. Then, we'd hit-up la Quinta Avenida, also just behind the property. Perhaps the best discovery we made was the actual beach itself. If you walk south of the pier, the beach turns to total crap. Mucky water rolls up onto the sandbag-lined shore. The water is either infested with rocks or tied-up fishing boats. But, our beach was perfect. It was wide enough to accommodate hotel guests and the public and the water was rock and muck free! Plus, this section of sand attracts a lot of Italians. You couldn't ask for better sight seeing. Some people have complained about the noise coming from Mamitas, but we hardly noticed it. It's a bit louder during the day on Saturdays, but that gives the atmosphere a lively vibe. They turn off the music at night and all you can hear is the sound of the ocean throughout the resort. All in all, this was a great stay. We're really grateful for the advice from fellow travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lessie1230
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Las Palapas and had a great time. This is our second stay and we were not disappointed. The room was clean, perfectly situated on the beach, and the staff as friendly as ever. Carlos brought us lunch everyday to our patio and Juan greeted us by name each morning at breakfast. Rafael at the front desk was so helpful and informative. The reason I didn't rate it a 5 is that it's a small, somewhat rustic resort. No phones or tv but there is wireless throughout the hotel. This is NOT an all inclusive behemoth of a hotel. It's a small, friendly place where you can enjoy the lush gardens and beautiful beach. Simply wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit and Review”
Reviews.Author: kansascity000
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to Las Palapas and it was like returning home! Mariela, in Reservations, gave us a special rate after contacting her as the rates had gone up since our visit last year. The location at the north end of Playa with a beautiful shady beach (or sun) is perfect and there is a bar for food and drink within steps. The drive down into the hotel gives an idea of what's ahead and the grounds of the hotel are something--the park area leading to the beach is gorgeous. As is the Casa Club where you can drink and dine in the evening. I totally love the palapa roofs over the personal patio area where you have chairs and hammocks. Everything is laid back and pleasant--no frantic music here (tho you can hear pounding music from Mamita's Dance bar in the evening.) One afternoon, there was a wonderful flute player at the beach bar. Close by on 5th Avenue are some non-touristy dining spots--or you can walk to the busier areas. (Try the Cuban restaurant. Also, the great bakery on the corner.) Probably one of the most amazing things about this trip was the fact that Juan, who serves breakfast, recognized us and called us by name--and our last visit was nearly l4 months ago! We were astounded. That gives you an idea of the staff! Highly recommended! (And thanks, Mariela.)

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: vic123kansas
Reviews.Content: There were four friends in a double garden room and even though the rooms are very basic, we were quite comfortable.The first night we were aware of the music coming from a club down the beach but it stopped around 9 PM and really wasn't an issue for us. We had a couple of things go wrong in our room and the service to get repairs were very quick.There is so much hudidity that it is difficult to keep things in good repair but they try very hard. The staff are absolutely top notch. Every waiter, grounds keeper and reception went out of their way to be helpful. Every contact spoke to us and had a smile. The beach was clean and well maintained.There could of been more beach chairs available but it wasn't a big issue just to trow down a towel and make do. We were just fascinated with all the tropical plants, many blooming and many Coati, birds and yes plenty of Iquana to surprise us on our walks.The shopping area 5th Ave, was a few minutes walk and reception would get a cab for us within a minute or two to go out to any resturant we wanted.We were glad not to have a TV in room and didn't miss a phone. The WiFi worked just fine for emailing home and there were computers in lobby that we could use for free. I would return for the personal assistance from the staff and the beautiful grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: thereisonlyoneofme
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Las Palapas during the start of our tour through Mexico. Staff were very friendly and service was good. Breakfast was a good start to the day with fresh omelettes made every day, plenty of fruit and different offerings. The room was average, very spacious large bed but a rather hard mattrass. Decoration was quite minimal and bathroom was a little dated although all in working order. A bottle of water was provided as well. We enjoy lounging in the hammocks in front of our bungalow although I was eaten alive by musquitos in the evening, nothing seemed to deter them. The grouns of the hotel are very well maintained and I enjoyed the surroundings. The hotel is build in 2 storey bungalows and in general a quiet area of Playa del Carmen. Beach also very well maintained and tidy. There is a beach service of drinks and a daily cocktail special. Lunch is fresh, tasty and again a good selection of lunch options. There is a pool as well and it looked clean and inviting but we decided to relax on the beach. I would definately return and recommend others to stay at las Palapas. We enjoyed our stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, relaxing spot”
Reviews.Author: stormiestemm
Reviews.Content: love this place! Loved the thatched roof room....felt like real mexico! Breakfast was delicious, the grounds are beautiful, and you can walk to 5th ave no problem from this beach location. Excellent restaurants & shopping all around to choose from. Beach bar serves excellent drinks & doesn't skimp on the alcohol! Far enough off the beaten path to get away from the crazy party noise that is right in town.......We loved this place and will surely return if we ever stay in Playa again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: rgarcia3508
Reviews.Content: Not only is the beach the best in Playa, but the staff at Las Palapas is exceptional. Front desk staff is very knowledgable and recommended some great "authentic" mexican restaraunts. Breakfast is wonderful. Fresh fruits and juices every day, as well as omelits, bacon and sausages. The grounds are immaculate. Staff keep the place beautiful. I hope to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: larstill
Reviews.Content: Las Palapas Hotel is a delightful place to spend a couple of weeks. The thatched-roof cabannas are set around rhe edge of a large treed space close to the beach. Staff are charming and helpful. Vast buffet-type Breakfast, included in the room-rate, is excellent. The next door property, is a sort of disco-hotel, pounding out a monotomousand head-pouding beat during the day. After a day or so you can "tune" it out of your hearing and just enjoy the blue waters of the Caribbean and the white sand. Delightful indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - paradise right on the town!”
Reviews.Author: lilbee99
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 6 nights at Las Palapas and found the hotel fantastic. Yes there was music some days between 2-7 but not on Sundays and Mondays. This is from Mamitas next door and not anything that the hotel can really control. We had a great bungalow - 9 which was 4 back from the beach, huge 4 poster bed with no tv which we loved! This was right next to the pool which was also lovely and quiet as everyone seemed to be on the beach. The live jazz band that played on Sunday afternoon was great and we loved having drinks and food delivered to us at the pool. Breakfast buffet was really delicious free wifi in our room was great. Its right on 5th but you would never know, we felt like we were in a jungle paradise! Not the best if you are an old couple and dont like hearing music during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Oasis of Natural Beauty”
Reviews.Author: AliveBarely
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe you are in the "middle" of Playa del Carmen in this gorgeous spot. Beautiful grounds, lots of birds and the beach is perfect. The staff are very accomodating and friendly. You have to ignore the "Beach Club" next door boom out its music for a few hours every afternoon and don't order the spinach salad! Otherwise it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not Relaxing. Too Crowded.”
Reviews.Author: cwgedge
Reviews.Content: After reading nice reviews and looking at a pleasant website, we were very surprised to find a crowded beach with rental beach chairs for the public, a large party scene, a shady/cold pool, and not to mention the large club next door that blasts outdoor music all afternoon. You can hear the music pounding throughout the hotel and the echo in the room makes it even worse. The staff and management were very nice and were apologetic about our experience, but their service was not exceptional considering we were so unhappy. The hotel restaurant was romatic (if you take the beach table) and it had decent options. The room was its own hut which was romatic. We prepaid a special rate online so we found ourselves in a difficult position when we arrived and realized that we were very unhappy with the resort/location. We are a young couple and are willing to put up with some things, but it was too much to handle. We asked for a refund and moved to a different hotel after one night. Bottom line: if you want a relaxing and romatic experience, I do not recommend this hotel. It failed to meet our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Some things good, some things bad..”
Reviews.Author: artistina81
Reviews.Content: The service is very good, we were very happy with the guards, the room cleaning and the staff at the casa club and at the breakfast. The service at the beach was slow, and service for ordinary guests closed while there was a wedding, which we would have liked to know beforehand. The room was okay and the aircon great, but the bathroom needs to be renewed, and just changing the yellow curtains could do a lot! The beach was fine, but the music from mamitas was disturbing. Because of that I would recommend a hotel further north, mahekal looked nice, maybe it's more quiet. The food was okay, the breakfast quite good although some food got melty because of the heat. Great to see animals running around! All in all good, but not everything;)

Reviews.Title: “Best view for a breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: demind
Reviews.Content: Cheap and nice breakfast with a great outside view.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: tristamacaulay
Reviews.Content: we and our family (in total, 4 rooms) were guests at Las Palapas in Playa del Carmen from 26/12/2011 until 3 January 2012, During the entire stay we were subject to blaring techno music from 9 AM until past midnight every day and night from a neighboring beach front property. And I don't mean just in the background, but to the point where we had to talk loudly to one another in our rooms to speak over the monotonous beat. Ear plugs at night couldn't drown the music. It was a major headache and affected the quality of the vacation in a HUGE way. Given the size of the event and the promotion involved one must assume that there was more than enough time to forewarn the guests so that they could have made other plans. As it was, the only notice we received was in the form of a circular distributed on the afternoon of the 26th. AFTER the techno music was playing ALL DAY and ALL NIGHT. The food was some of the worst we have ever had. BAD cruise ship type of food. No fresh juices for juice or drinks...Speaking of drinks, stay away, awful, with fake ingredients. Just plain bad. Las Palapas rents out their beach front lounge chairs to day pass people off the beach. By the time we got down to the beach at around 9:30 AM ALL of the front chairs were taken TO DAY PASS GUESTS, they don't care for or save the good chairs for their guests. Awful. One final point, the beach was subject to the smell of sewer - seemed to emanate from a source north of the Palapas' beach. It stunk so badly it made me feel dirty. Between all of the above we didn't spend one day at the beach there, but would rather be anywhere but at Las Palapas. AWFUL experience. Period.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but music from next door property is loud and repetitive”
Reviews.Author: Terry L
Reviews.Content: Like the hotel, but it's loud and the music from next store has then same rhythmic beat hour after hour, I'm writing this from the pool area of the hotel and it's been like this days. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place but terrible Beach disco Right next donor”
Reviews.Author: Kim R
Reviews.Content: If it wasn't for the Beach disco Right next door, that makes a horrible noise - loud enough to overpower an iphone+earphones set at max volume - from 1am to 11.30 pm. Las palapas would be a Perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, laid-back hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSPguy55408
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel with laid-back luxury, privacy and solitude, and excellent service set in a beautiful, natural setting, Hotel Las Palapas is the one to beat. The hotel is conveniently located off 5th avenue with immediate access to the most beautiful beach. Each "room" is its own thatched-roof house, with hammocks outside and comfortable amenities inside: all separated from each other by beautifully manicured walkways lined with rain forest vegetation and flowering plants. Food at the hotel is very good and all of the restaurant employees provide excellent service, most particularly Bolom at the Casa Club restaurant and Carlos at the beach bar, both of whom are extremely friendly, service-oriented, and fun to chat with. The pool area is lovely and uncrowded, even during peak season, with extremely comfortable chairs and plenty of palapas and umbrellas to provide shade from the sun. The beach area offers immaculate stretches of white powder dotted with mature palm trees, hammocks for napping, comfortable chairs for tanning, and great chair service from the beach bar and restaurant. Unlike many beach resorts at playa that feature booming, bass-heavy techno music, Las Palapas offers quiet respite with soft tropical music, exotic bird calls, and primarily, the sound of the ocean beating against the shore. Service throughout the hotel is excellent. If you're looking for an American-style mega-resort with corporate restaurants and formal service, this might not be the place for you. But if you, like we, greatly prefer a more casual, laid-back vacation experience in a smaller hotel with authentic, personal interactions with the staff, you'll love Las Palapas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Charming, Hidden Away Jewel”
Reviews.Author: DavefromCA92629
Reviews.Content: Great place if you want to decompress! Tucked between the beach and beautifully maintained jungle gardens. The hotel is situated basically near the end of 5th street. Perfect walking distance to restaurants and shops. On the beach there is a great dive shop that caters to the needs of the folks who are interested in water sports. I've been to this hotel many times and the staff is what makes it so special. They love their work and truly enjoy the interaction with the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Changes, some good some bad....”
Reviews.Author: 50JH
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Palapas 5 times now and really enjoy the small hotel feel, the excellent beach, the grounds are second to none, and great workers. However, the last time we were there our requested room AC was not working, they moved us to another room and that AC was also not working. Finally, they moved us to a temporary room untill our original rooms AC could be fixed. That left us feeling unsettled and uncertain as to what was going to happen. The AC was fixed about 30 hours later and we were moved back to our original room. We felt like we lost a day of our vacation. We had an issue with our room on the previous stay also and had to be moved. Since changing ownership the hotel is going through some growing pains. They have improved the look and feel a bit, but raised the drink prices and reduced the quality. Beers are all cans now and the cocktails are mostly mixes. The breakfast is always excellent, the rest of the food is mediocre at best. For the price you can stay at one of the All Inclusive hotels in town, but we prefer the old Mexico feel and being on the north end of PDC. In this case I think you are actually paying more for less. We wish some of the old Las Palapas would come back (mostly drinks) and the rooms would be improved a bit at this price point. The music from Mamaitas (mostly bass) could be an issue, especially if you are staying on the south side of the property, request the north side and you should be OK. Not really an issue for us. We expect to be back however, this might be our last time if things aren't improved. I hope this isn't the case! We have vacationed in PDC for the last 8 years now and appreciate the quaint homey feel of the hotel. We understand that sometimes these things happen and try to roll with it, although we would prefer some things change back.

Reviews.Title: “magical”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer N
Reviews.Content: just returned from a very laid back week at Las Palapas,what a magical place.It is worlds away from the huge all-inclusives which abound in Mexico.The accommodation is simple,no tv or telephones, perfect for escaping the rest of the planet for a few days.The restaurants are excellent,the staff very friendly and welcoming,nothing is too much trouble.The beach is stunning,I'm now addicted to the local beach webcam!!!The hotel is a short walk from the main shopping street which buzzes in the evenings yet is far enough removed to be quiet and secluded. This was my second visit to Las Palapas and I hope to return again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Pauline011
Reviews.Content: This was the second year of staying at this hotel because we loved it so much the first time. Last year the staff and customer service could not be faulted. However, this year was a different story. There had been a mix up with our booking in that we had booked an extra day's stay through travel republic but had got the date wrong. The hotel harassed us almost every day for confirmation of the date change from our holiday provider. This should have been straight forward as the night had been paid for already and a simple date change on their computer should have been enough. We were continually harassed which caused stress and anxiety for the entire stay until it was eventually sorted. We were there for eight days, already paid for but every time we passed reception we were harassed. There were also notes on our door. It caused friction between my partner and I and ruined our stay. Also, we had booked a trip to Tulum where we needed a wake up call at 6.30am, as neither of us had taken our mobiles on holiday and had no alarm system. The wake up call never came. By sheer chance I woke up ten minutes before we had to leave and we had to run to get to the pick up point. When we told reception, no apology. On our last day we paid for and arranged a transfer to the airport at 11am. 11.20am passed and no taxi, so we asked reception...it had never been arranged and had to wait another 15minutes on one being sent out, so we were half an hour late at the airport. I have also experienced credit card fraud transactions from Mexico since returning to the UK and my card was only used in 2 places, Las Palapas hotel to settle the bill on departure and Canibal Royal beach bar. I suspect it may have been swiped at the hotel. It's such a shame because the staff last year were so good and our stay was heavenly. This year was stressful, staff were unreliable and the stay disappointing. The hotel itself is amazing, such a shame the staff let it down. It made me very sad. I'm sorry to say that we won't be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, one unpleasant incident”
Reviews.Author: MatildaTakesWorld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Las Palapas last february for two weeks. We are a couple in our thirties and this was our 5th trip to Mexico, Playa del Carmen. We have stayed in a few Rius and at the Royal PdC and wanted to stay at a hotel that is not AI. The location is perfect, just a few steps away from La Quinta and nowadays there's a lot going on at the north end of 5th. Lots of shops and restaurants of all kinds. The rooms are different from each other I guess. Prior to our trip I saw photos of some fresh, bohemian style rooms and our room was nothing like that. It was a very basic room, not very fancy but functionally it was fine, not very pretty though. You could have a small fridge delivered to your room, can't remember how much it cost but it was not expensive. Bed and mattress were good. The shower was ok but could use a better lighting. We were on the first floor and the terrace was really nice to sit in the evening. The wifi doesn't work really, neither does the connection the reception's computers. The beach was lovely, good to swim. There was a beach bar where you can get drinks and food. Drinks were good but the food was just ok. And the food was overpriced, at the beach bar and the actual restaurant. Also I had a bit of trouble finding anything to eat during the day, there were no proper salads. At day time I don't want to eat anything heavy and wanted salad but the caesar salad was basically maybe 4 big leaves of lettuce and some salad dressing... make it a bit more appealing please! Tacos al pastor were good. In the end for lunch we decided to get pizza slices from 5th Ave, near the hotel, they were a total bargain and very, very good quality! The breakfast buffet was awesome at the hotel, very good food! You could have an omelette cooked the way you prefer, bacon, yoghurt and fruit etc. The music from Mamitas beach club is pretty loud considering it's not right next to this property. It didn't really bother me but I was I knew about it before I went. To our room it sounded just like a monotonic bass going on and on. I think there's nothing you can do and if you are going high season the hotel is most likely to be full and you cannot be moved to a quieter location. But the music is not so loud that you couldn't hear anything else, you can hear the birds etc still. The birds will wake you up in the morning, but I thought that was really nice. We had one unpleasant incident. Our room was at the back of the jungle side, far away from the beach. Behind our room there was a shed where some maintenance equipment etc was stocked and to the shed there was a similar path than elsewhere in the property. Our room had one window facing the shed but there are some trees and other plants in front so that you cannot see straight to the room from the shed. One morning I was in our room and my boyfriend was in the shower. I was in my bikini getting ready to go to the beach when I saw something moving in the window facing the shed. There was a man standing behind the window, he had come through the plants and trees area and was literally in our window peeping in! I saw that this guy was mexican based on the haircut and the shape of his face. I ran to the bathroom to tell my boyfriend but the man noticed I noticed him and had already gone when we went out. We went to the reception to tell about the incident. The german (?) receptionist listened and said: mexican men are pretty eager to see european women! We asked if we could be moved because I was now afraid of going in to the room but ofcourse there was nothing they could offer. They said they would increase security but it surely didn't take away my fear. I don't know if he was peeping in to see a naked european woman or to see if there was something to steal I didn't enjoy the next week we stayed at the room. And even though the receptionist was pretty nice to me when I told her this there was no apologies or anything made. This is now the only reason I would not return, unfortunately. If I owned a hotel I would've maybe offered a percentage of discount on the tab we had (you have it to your room and pay when you leave the resort) or sent a bottle of bubbly to our room to make it clear that the hotel is sorry for the inconvenience. To sum up, all the rooms are not fancy but still ok and the location is perfect. Beach is good and people working there are nice. Mostly europeans. For us the incident surely ruined our stay, it could have been worse but it was enough to make us unfomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Destination Wedding”
Reviews.Author: skyhawkd
Reviews.Content: We got married on the beach at Las Palapas and enjoyed staying 6 days at Las Palapas. There are so many hotels in Playa but this one is truly a gem. Our room was right on the water with great hammocks to relax in. We had ~ 40 guests staying as well and everyone raved about the hotel. The breakfast buffet is amazing and is so fresh. The best way to wake up in the morning! We loved that this was a small hotel that wasn't swarming with other guests. Our wedding was wonderful and after the reception we went swimming in the ocean and then the pool. They also have a dive shop next door so many guests were able to snorkel/scuba dive. They also helped arrange a charter bus tour to Chichen Itza for our group. We look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “They gave me more than expected... Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mario A
Reviews.Content: It's an excelent hotel, hospitality & comfort it's great. In addition, the marvelous beach is so near, it is so clear that you can see your own feet perfectly inside the water. the price is low. I recommend this paradise...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place!”
Reviews.Author: legaltravelor
Reviews.Content: This place is great. I plan on staying here exclusively on future trips to the Yucatan. On the beach. Great pool. Walking distance to everything in playa del carmen, yet not in the middle of the tourist traps. Please note that this is a "back to nature" type place. We had a lizard living in our room. We saw many iguanas and even a Coati Mundi at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a relaxing break away”
Reviews.Author: jendarmy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I enjoyed a week in Playa del Carmen staying at Las Palapas the last week of June. Our room was huge. We enjoyed the hammocks on our verandah which always gave us a laugh as we tried to get back out of them. We had a couple of issues with the bathroom taps and toilet when we first arrived but both were fixed within an hour. We loved the beach bar and especially happy hour. Now back home to winter weather I wish I was back at Las Palapas, relaxing on the deckchairs overlooking the warm caribbean sipping a mojita, what a life. Las Palapas was very quiet. Breakfast was included and there was plenty of variety. Although at the end of town there were always taxi's just near the entrance if we needed one. We definitely stay at Las Palapas again.

Reviews.Title: “Sad to downgrade my review....”
Reviews.Author: mhcoates
Reviews.Content: I had originally written the review below in March 2011 soon after returning from Playa. However, the review was written before I saw my credit card statement and realized I had been overcharged. We were charged more per night than the room rate than our travel agent confirmed months previously. (I think the room rate quote was based on us paying in cash (?). But we were never informed that we needed to pay in cash to get the quoted room rate!?!?!) The exchange rate that was specifically quoted at check out by the receptionist was NOT the exchange rate we actually received. I had clarified the exchange rate with the receptionist and double checked everything at check out...I thought. Wrong....when I returned home and checked my credit card, the charges were $100 more than I was told they would be. I emailed with Las Palapas from March 2011- August 2011 and they still have not corrected the charge. I enjoyed my stay there greatly but I warn all fellow travelers to check your credit card charges before you leave so you can correct anything there in person. I can see that other travelers have had this same issue. It is very unfortunate that Las Palapas has not corrected the issue. Everything about Las Palapas Hotel itself is wonderful. We loved the breakfast buffet. I loved hearing the ocean, the wind and the animal/bird noises every morning. The beach location is superb. The rooms were comfortable and quiet at night and in the morning. The service and food from the beach bar were surprisingly really good! The grounds of Las Palapas are beautiful, so many plants, trees, animals. We really enjoyed our stay there. However, we went on vacation to relax, lay by the beach, read books, and just hang out and the Mamitas Beach Club music significantly interfered with all of those plans...So I am sad to say I would not return for one important reason: the afternoon noise from the Mamitas Beach Club next door. It's really unfortunate how far the Mamitas music travels and how it negatively affects Las Palapas. Mamitas is actually separated from Las Palapas by a huge jungle/lot but the sound is just too loud. I love club music but not very loud music for 6 hours a day. The intensity of the music/noise from Mamitas really varies around Las Palapas which is why some TripAdvisor reviewers don't mention it and others do. In some areas, like the beach and the side of the property bordering the Mahekal resort, the music is less noticable, which is great for the guests who happen to have rooms that are in that area. For example, in the beach houses, the sound of the waves mostly drowns out the music which is great. And when you are on the beach itself, you barely hear the music because the sounds of the ocean. But for the majority of rooms, you can definitely hear the Mamitas afternoon music. We spent all our afternoon time on the beach even when we didn't really want to be there so we could avoid hearing the loud music. As soon as you walk into the Las Palapas property and reach the Casa Club/pool area, you start to hear a loud bass beat and you can't escape from it anywhere on the resort property! For the majority of the rooms you can hear a steady loud bass beat from about 1 p.m - 7 p.m. each day. So relaxing quietly in the hammock and reading, or taking a nap in your room, is not be possible in the afternoon. You pay for a wonderful room that you have to avoid 25 % of the time because of another resort's noise. So if relaxing at your hotel and in your palapa are important for your vacation, I would proceed with caution. If you are going to be out every afternoon, in town, or doing other tourist type tours, the Mamitas noise probably won't be an issue for you. Also, although they advertise WiFi, the wireless only worked about 30 minutes total out of our 7 day stay. On the hotel lobby computers, the internet did work about 50 % of the time. Las Palapas is a mostly wonderful resort, but the Mamitas music is unfortunately an issue. I would recommend it to a friend but only after explaining the music situation to them. So although the hotel amenities make this a "very good" hotel in rating, the music situation is a significant daily annoyance that brings the rating down to "average".

Reviews.Title: “A great discovery! / Fantastische Entdeckung!”
Reviews.Author: Lobagola
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Playa del Carmen, the place has been highly recommended by my sister, then by my niece, and in a sudden by everyone we know and asked about Playa. But a little detail was missing, which hotel to chose. There were some recomendations, all located in the town. We always have preferred one near the beach, we then performed a search and found "Las Palapas", it looked confortable, a few steps from the beach, nothing to do with those big ostentatious buildings that proliferate these days in every touristic destination. "Las Palapas" bring a cozy setting, with good food, fine drinks, excellent service by friendly people, some of them with a fluent german, all bilingual in English-Spanish, and suppose many of them also speak french. The hotel has a "Library", a collection of maybe 100 titles, mostly in german, some in English and a few more in French, not one in Spanish! I think this is due to the fact that we spend less time vacationing and do not run out of books so easely, ha ha ha. Finally, the beach in front of the hotel is splendid, but if you or your childrens prefer the pool, there is also one at your disposition. Consequently "Las Palapas" has come to enlarge my list of preferred hotels, and Playa del Carmen has being added to places like Puerto Escondido and Huatulco. Believe me, we had a great time, why not you! Oh! I forgot to tell you that just walking a few blocks from the hotel, you will find a wealth of places where to have dinner, a coffee, or just walk and see people, a lot of people sightseeing like you, this place is called Fifth Avenue!

Reviews.Title: “Las Palapas vs Mahekal 2010 and 2011”
Reviews.Author: kikineedsbeach
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth trip to the PDC area and we've stayed at both Las Palapas (feb 2011) and at Mahekal (formerly Shangri-La Caribe Dec 2010). Las Palapas is great because the beach is shaded by a grove of palm trees and there are big couches and oversized chairs to sit in, plus a great place to eat lunch under the palm trees at real tables. The beach bar at Las Palapas is ok, the seats are little stools in the sand. They have free drinks for ladies at 2-3 pm (I think) and happy hour for everybody, 2 for one drinks, at 5-7? something like that. For 3 of us for 7 nights hotel, in Feb 2011, with all you can eat breakfast, with all of our drinks, alcohol for hubby (beer x3 or 4/day) plus my 1 margarita, then the virgin pina for DD every day, lunch 5 days, it was $1742. You really can't beat it. Mahekal's beach isn't as shady (of course there are palapas everywhere that you can sit under, but I love the palm tree leaves drifting in the breeze up above at Las Palapas) At Mahekal, for lunch, families usually go off the beach to the restaurant to sit at a table. You can get the beach bar staff to deliver your lunch to your lounge chairs, but eating on lounge chairs is challenging with kids. There are no tables on the beach at Mahekal, or there weren't in Feb 2011 nor Dec 2010. Mahekal has a cute bar with swings, on the property but you can go there whether you stay there or not. Mahekal seems more expensive but we stayed there over the holidays in 2010-11 so everything costs more. They were offering, last I checked, hotel room plus breakfast and dinner. Kids free. So you can't really compare apples to apples due to Las Palapas' rates included bfast only. Just so you know, Mahekal will swap your dinner for lunch, if you let them know by 10am, that was their policy when we were there. We loved having lunch on the beach and going out for dinner. The street life at night is pretty great. Kids everywhere and tons of fantastic restaurants. As for the rooms, I've stayed at 2 different rooms at both properties, and the thatched roof "palapa" rooms on the beach just can't be beat, at either place, but they are of course the most expensive. We were upgraded at LP, due to a flooded bathroom in our "jungle" room. The jungle rooms at LP are actually perfect, they are really big with a seating area inside and a nice porch or deck with 2 hammocks and 2 oversized wicker chairs and a table. At LP the least expensive rooms are bigger by 2x than the least expensive at Mahekal. The jungle at LP actually has monkeys running around you wouldn't believe it, after a while they remind you of squirrels, they scavenge and beg. Either place is fabulous, you really can't go wrong. In February 2011 we stayed in a Jungle room at Las Palapas and were upgraded to a beach front room due to our 1st room flooded. We were very patient with LP front desk and stayed in the Jungle room for the first 3 days, until it was clear that the plumbing problem was out of control. We came back from the beach and the whole room was flooded and our door was wide open, with no workers inside. I was calm and friendly when I told the front desk the story, and after some back and forth they offered us another room and $25 off every night of our stay. Then about 40 minutes later, they came and found me on the beach and offered the beach bungalow for the same price (no $25 discount) for the rest of our stay. It was an amazing room, like a fantasy of what a beach front room would look like. Gorgeous. We jumped at it and really enjoyed our time there. in our first Jungle room: Sink no water - a trickle at best sheets not clean - sand/and or flying debris on the sheets No washcloths at all in the bathroom Wc didn't flush well or sometimes at all, just a weak swirl Wc seat broken, crooked on bowl - as you stood it would hit you every time Musty smells throughout the room. Windows didn't open in bathroom - hence the musty smells! Electricity switch in the closet was operated by the closet door closing and it was a bare wire that sparked blue when you opened and shut the door. Perhaps the plumbing problems explain the musty moldy smells? When I asked about the sink and toilet not working, they sent a succession of workmen and plumbers and that's when the big problems started. - the flooding, the workmen in our room all day, etc. At either Mahekal or LP, if you tip the staff even moderately, you will get special treatment and very good service. Try to speak a little spanish, ask if they have kids, how many, etc, and you will get big smiles and a fairly genuine connection. The people in PDC have always been great to us and we are thankful they are sharing their beautiful country with us. Wifi was quite spotty but there was free internet access in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing, will definitely stay there again and recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: gizelle_krn
Reviews.Content: i cannot speak for resorts further from playa del carmen, but this resort was by far the best in the immediate vicinity of town. it is a 20-second walk to the beach, another 3 minutes to the main strip of shops and restaurants, and had the absolute most beautiful beach compared to the other resorts in the area. it was nicely removed from the busy all-inclusives, and you could make this as all-inclusive (or not) as you want. the service was impeccable and the staff was amazing, pleasant, and truly hospitable. FYi - the wifi did not work while we were there. annoying, but not a deal-breaker for us.

Reviews.Title: “nice property, but lousy rooms and tasteless food”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraDavideSvizzer
Reviews.Content: the garden is lovely and the crew extremely friendly. but do not expect anything from the rooms! they're getting old, seem worn out and would need maintenance. we recommend to just take breakfast and eat out at dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel situated in a manicured jungle that opens onto a perfect beach.”
Reviews.Author: marydown
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Las Palapas for a week, and every day was a joy. Wake up to a great breakfast buffet with lots of fresh fruit, hot dishes, a large assortment of bread (including fresh baked whole wheat), and an omelet chef ready to prepare eggs any style you like, and excellent coffee and fresh fruit juices. This hotel is right on the beach in the section we judged to be the most lovely, rock free section of beach in Playa. There is a shower near the beach to rinse off after a dip in the ocean, which is very refreshing.The hotel pool is near the beach, and there is a beach bar. We had lunch at the beach bar one day, and the food was good, interesting, and plenty of it. All the buildings have palapa roofs, even the beach chairs have little palapas for your comfort at the beach. The rooms are all individual palapa topped buildings with your own private veranda. In the older section (where our room was) all the buildings are carefully situated to provide maximum privacy for each room, and sitting on our veranda was like having our own home in the middle of this gentle jungle. The newer section has less privacy, but it's closer to the beach and pool. The staff was friendly and professional, at all times. This hotel is not for folks who want a modern, high rise hotel, or if you don't like to be close to nature. Also, there is no phone or tv in the rooms, and no room service. Our room was perfect for us, but we definitely felt we were splurging on a beach front hotel. You can get a room in a really nice hotel in Playa for half the cost if it's a couple of blocks from the beach. This was our treat to ourselves, and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, stops just short of amazing..”
Reviews.Author: emmajr23
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I travelled to Las Palapas in the beginning of May 2011. We chose the hotel based on its prime location between the beach and 5th Avenue, and being New Yorkers, we really loved the idea of being able to disconnect from everything and just be part of nature. Las Palapas definitely delivered on these fronts, and we did have a few complaints, but we will say one thing about the hotel - DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU DO NOT LIKE NATURE!! I cannot stress this enough. I have read some reviews about "ants in the bedroom" or "mosquitos in the outdoor TV hut," and while this could be annoying for some, they should have known what they were getting themselves into.. Las Palapas does not advertise themselves as a 5-star hotel that caters to those who want a high-end hotel experience. No, this is quite different, and it's not for everyone, but we LOVED it. ROOMS - We stayed in room 104, which was probably one of the better cabanas in the entire resort. It was tucked away in the corner of the jungle so really did not have many people walking by at all. Only issue with the location was its proximity to Mamita's. Yes, we read the reviews from others who complained and were worried about this, and yes, it did get a little annoying. Music played daily from about 12-6 (seemed to get lounder closer to 4-6) which made it difficult to relax out in our hammocks. Also played very loud music on Friday night but it stopped around 12. Other than that, we LOVED our cabana! Most other cabanas are two-story but this was one floor. Large sitting area, large patio with two chairs and two hammocks, large sexy bathroom, and nice king bed (with "mosquito net," not exactly functional but definitely turned up the sexy factor). There were some teeny tiny ants but we sprayed a little OFF! and that seemed to help.. Safe is small so don't expect to be able to put a computer in there or anything, I would bring a lock for your suitcase if you want to keep large things locked away. No fridge, but I believe you can rent one for $2 USD/day (we didn't have a problem with this!) And the best part, no TV or phone in the room. We loved being able to disconnect from technology for a week, I mean, who really NEEDS to watch TV when you have such beautiful surroundings?! Really people, stop complaining about it, remember why you're on vacation... I don't think you go on vacation to watch TV or play on the computer, at least I hope not.. BEACH - The beach was absolutely gorgeous. I'm almost positive townies were coming and paying to hang out because it is just ideal. Plenty of palapas for shade and chairs for lounging. Only complaint is that the staff at the beach bar are a little lazy... They hide out in the shade and only come walk around to ask if you need anything once or twice throughout the day. I didn't even bother with waiting and just went up to bar to get things myself. The cashier (yes, only one person is allowed to run the cash register) rarely had change (we opted to settle each bill rather than charging it to our room) and even after spending two minutes counting change didn't even give us the right amount... I don't think it should be too difficult to find someone trustworthy who can actually add/subtract and count $$. Still, the staff was nice and never really gave us any attitude or anything. They also offer yoga on the beach Tues-Sun 8-9AM. I believe it costs money and if you pay a little extra you get a power breakfast included (we never participated but seemed like it would be nice). CASA CLUB - We loved the bartender at the Casa Club. He was really nice and made the best margaritas in town. We also realized on the last day that they keep board games and cards here (would have been nice to know about that!) Also, from 5-7 (on the beach too!) it's happy hour so you get 2 for 1 drinks. HEALTH CENTER - Did not try the health center but from what we saw it looked very nice. It was right next to our cabana. Apparently they have spa services but you can also get massages right by the beach. POOL - Didn't go into the pool once. Who needs it when you have the most beautiful blue waters right there? It looked a little green (heavy on the chlorine??) so we stayed away.. BREAKFAST - Anyone who complained about breakfast is silly. It was delicious and filling and included in price of room. Best part was made-to-order eggs, fresh fruit, and amazing coffee. LUNCH/DINNER - We had lunch at the beach bar three times. While it's good and convenient, we found it to be a bit overpriced. I suggest going to Chez Celine (walk to 5th Ave and it's right there on the left) for amazing sandwiches at a more reasonable price. Our first night we were so tired from travelling that we opted to stay in for dinner. DInner was being served buffet style on the beach. It was a cool experience and the food was pretty good, but for $250 pesos per person? So not worth it. OTHER - We loved the little outdoor hut with the TV and library. We didn't watch TV once but enjoyed playing ping pong and pool. Really, we just suggest taking a walk/playing some ping pong if you get bored here. Bring lots of books. And don't forget, 5th Avenue is right nearby if you want to get a little more action. Overall, WE LOVED IT! We'll probably come back some time in the future but since we've gone to PDC two years in a row, we'll most likely venture elsewhere.. Definitely will stay at Las Palapas if we come back to Playa!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, PHENOMINAL BEACH”
Reviews.Author: pawnit2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Las Palapas 3 nights late April. The hotel has a great location (about 34th??? and 5th ave, right across the street from Real Playa Del Carmen). SO close to all the action, although the restaurants near hotel on 5th aren't that great. Be sure to check out the nature walking trail in between the resort and 5th (it's on the right) very cool. Hotel rooms are very nice, although a little dirty at times. There were also some bugs. There is a ton of wildlife running around. Lizards, monkeys, ect. The Palapas are all spread out, seemingly secluded. Some are in the "jungle", some very near the beach. It is quite rare that you actually see someone when you are at your palapa (if your room is near the lighthouse...) Its very nice. The pool is very nice, secluded, but near the beach. The entire 4 days we were there, I think the main bar was open once as we passed, and this was late at night. As far as the beach bar, service is pretty much nonexistent unless you sit down at the bar. Lily(?) at the beach bar was the only employee at either bar who stepped up, went out of their way and did a good job. The other employees at the beach bar seemed like they tried to do as little as they could. The service at the beach bar (outside of Lily(?) was terrible. Overall I thought this hotel was very nice. Most of that has to do with the beach and the location though. The beach at this place is amazing! Best beach in PDC hands down. Not crowded, white sand, NO ROCKS, shallow. Unbelievable. If you want beach, go here. This resort is not all inclusive, but they do provide breakfast. Don't believe what you read. The breakfast is ok at best. Many bugs flying all around the food at the buffet, warm milk, cold eggs.....As far as Mamitas beach club, we hardly noticed it. Our Palapa was located on the Mamita side but all the way in the back. We didnt hear it all that much, and when we did it wasn't bad. I wouldnt worry too much about that. Be sure to check out the view from the light house. Very cool. Front desk staff is very nice. Woman who checked us in and out was so nice (sorry I forgot your name!), helpful and caring. Also note that this place includes tips in all prices at the bar. I don't remember reading that being advertised but it may have been. Just a heads up. That would explain why a cuba libre is costing you 75 pesos! As far as the WIFI, yes it does go in and out. Not a big deal though. Seemed to work when we needed it to, and if it didnt, take 5 and come back and it did. Either way, like I said before, check it out if you like to lay on the beach (just don't tip beyond your means). Otherwise, move on to something all inclusive....

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: anonymousgirl2290
Reviews.Content: Last year we stayed at Mahekal next door, which was paridise. We thought we would get the same, since they are right next door, but that was not to be. The room had thousands of ants, and the hotel staff (who ever cleaned our room) also cleaned out a good amount of our money. Go somewhere else. This place is a rip off. The only good thing about this hotel was the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wide awake...in paradise...bring your egg crate mattress cover!”
Reviews.Author: jtpcopeland
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful, within walking distance of 5th Avenue, where all the shops and restaurants are, and is reasonably quiet. All the reviews are CORRECT about the discotech right next door. The techno thump is prevalent throughout most of the resort from 12pm to 8pm EVERYDAY, so no napping allowed. We were in cabana 43, which was on the other side of the resort and could still hear it over the hum of the A/C. The spa is so-so. You expect a spa to be dark, cool and inviting, but you are instantly hit with this bright light, and it was so hot I was dripping face down, until they turned on the A/C. I would highly recommend Christina for a rub...she may be small but she is amazing and strong! If you are not into children running about during your vacation, this might not be the place for you because apparently this is a kid-friendly establishment. I almost pushed one off the beach bar who was sitting indian-style next to my mojito. Where are these awful parents?!? Playa del Carmen is one hour from Cancun, so you can take a day trip. No concierge at Las Palapas (a shortcoming), so you are on your own as far as outings. My biggest problem with this resort is the FALSE advertising concerning the room and the beds. The rooms did not look as advertised on the website. Far from it. In addition, people come to paradise to relax and SLEEP, so naturally I was surprised when I discovered that the beds were so hard that your arms, hips and legs fall asleep (and not in a good way) if you stay on one side too long. I had to build myself a pallet of pillows to sleep on. You cannot put a sheet over a box spring and call that a mattress! Sorry folks!! Get some decent sleep gear!!

Reviews.Title: “Not far from being very good”
Reviews.Author: dhabes
Reviews.Content: After staying elsewhere in Playa on previous trips, my wife and I chose Las Palapas for this vacation. We didn't want a downtown hotel (too noisy), a giant hotel or all-inclusive resort. We wanted a nice hotel, somewhat secluded but still walking distance from good restaurants and whatnot. Las Palapas, in that regard, fit the bill nicely for us. We found Las Palapas as it was listed on the Morgans Hotel Group website as being managed by Morgans. As they run a tight ship, we has no qualms booking. After staying there, I can say that it was not up to the standard set at Morgans' properties. With a bit of work, however, it certainly can be. Positives- Location: In Playa, you don't often have a chance for jungle seclusion just a few steps from 5th Av, but Las Palapas provides exactly that. It's on the north end of 5th Av, but is set back from the road by a (somewhat long) driveway and plenty of vegetation. The north side of 5th has plenty of good food without the masses of tourists (or, at least, smaller masses of tourists). Beach: The beach is excellent. You don't have to walk three blocks...it's right at the shore (literally) of the property. The sand is soft, rock-free and palapas are very nice for shade in the hot sun. Without a twenty-minute cab ride to a mega resort, I don't think you'll find a comparable beach in Playa. No fishing boats. No sand bags. It's very nice. Rooms: The palapa-style rooms are also very nice. They're simple, spacious and (in some cases) tucked away in the jungle. We stayed in room 104 which was a "basic" room tucked toward the back of the property. We considered upgrading to a beachfront palapa, but stayed with 104 as it offered much more privacy and was a decent amount larger. Some of the palapas are double-decker, others offer little privacy (especially by the pool, restaurant or beach), but we felt nicely tucked away. Negatives- Mamitas: It's hard to blame Las Palapas for their neighbor, but Mamitas is an earsore. It's a beach club packed with Jersey Shore equivalents (be they Euro, South American, etc.), sipping red bull as if they just heard about it, with the droning bass of house music throughout the afternoon. Depending on the direction of the wind, you may hear it...and be bothered by it. You might also not notice. If Mamitas were a bit more considerate (speaker/subwoofer relocation), they could make things easier for their neighbors. I expect that the front desk at Las Palapas fields plenty of complaints. [For perspective...I'm not an old-timer...I'm a nightclub owner who is around loud music on a regular basis] Beach bar: We found the service by beach bar staff to be very poor. While hospitality workers (in general) in Playa are friendly and hard-working, the opposite was the case at the beach bar. Packs of staff would remain at the bar, not taking orders, not bussing tables, not delivering orders...just standing and talking. We placed orders that never arrived on multiple occasions. Once, when I asked if my order was coming (just two drinks...and I waited twenty minutes to inquire), I was told to come back later and pick them up myself. The only time that the staff seemed to work hard and pay attention was when the manager (owner?) was in the area. One might think that they just don't want to pester guests...no, not the case. When shifts are switching, they will instantly appear at your table requesting that you close your tab (rather than leaving you alone as they transfer to the new server). We were asked, one day, to close our tab after each order we placed. Frankly, the beach bar service was the worst part of the Las Palapas experience. It was almost as if the work had been contracted out to another company. I'm not one to complain about service [again...my business is hospitality and I'm sensitive to invalid complaints by pushy customers]. That was not the case here. It seemed to merely be a matter of employees not eager to work unless directly supervised. By way of contrast, the front desk and housekeeping/maintenance staff were very pleasant and hard working. Somewhat rundown property: Without a major investment, the property could be spruced up to Morgans' standards. The rustic, jungle vibe is perfect for the property, but new mattresses (that don't make a "BOINNNNGG" noise as you lie down) and bedding would be nice and welcomed. More comfortable beach chairs would also be a simple and dramatic change. Las Palapas is indeed a very nice property, but there does appear to be a bit of neglect. In general, I'd stay there again in Playa without hesitation. It's comfortable, it's well located and the beach is great. With some fairly simple changes, this could easily be a great property. Food notes: -Eat at "La B del M" (just 1/2 block north on 5th Av.). The food (cuban/mexican) is excellent, staff incredibly friendly and price very reasonable. -El Fogon (there are multiple locations on 30th) is great stop for local food. -Basico (5th and 12th?) has a very good casual restaurant on the 2nd floor with must-have blue crab tostadas..

Reviews.Title: “Not the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Traaaavel
Reviews.Content: While I was initially not going to express my opinion, it pains me to think that positive posts, by management in my opinion, are truly misleading. This place was a total rip off. They SCAMMED ME on the price that they confirmed, in writing, before I arrived. When I checked out, they presented me with a bill in Spanish and showing amounts in pesos. They rushed me out by saying that I needed to close out quickly or else their airport van would leave. When I got home and did the conversion, they cheated me out of over $100! When I called them, they said not to worry, just notify my credit card company and it will be fixed. When my credit card company asked them about it, they fought my company (contrary to their assurances) and used the receipt in Spanish to dispute their prior confirmation in English. Setting that aside, the ROOMS WERE DIRTY. There were ants on my floor and in my bed. Small ants, but there were tons of ants. The shower was gross, and required a towel to cover the sight of it. It took two complaints to get them to fix the shower so that we had hot water. The windows do not close all the way, so you can see people walk by while in the bathroom, hear people in adjoining rooms and people walking by, including the thumping sound from a bar down the beach, while trying to sleep. Even if they did not rip me off, I was grossed out by things that I experienced at this place. As for the TV that they told me I would have, it was in a mosquito filled outdoor hut. I will say, however, the staff was nice. That said, this experience was not unique to me. People who had a wedding there at the same time complained about being SCAMMED on the price of their rooms upon arrival and spoke of the DIRTY ROOMS. I, like others, was fooled into believing the positive posts (again, likely by management) that try to dispel the complaints that I read about this place. I should have gone with my gut and said that there is a reason why so many people post complaints about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed luxury in a shimmering setting”
Reviews.Author: Akersaway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend one week at Las Palapas based on a friend's recommendation. She had done the homework on where to stay in Playa del Carmen but hadn't stayed there yer. Boy, do we owe her bigtime! The resort lived up to the other Trip Advisor reviews....unbeatable location -- on beach and adjacent to eco-reserve and steps away from 5th Ave. restaurants and shops. Our casita was in a more private area of the resort with unbelievable lovely trees, flowers....peace. Staff were accomdating and breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of options. Because we were close to other restaurants we did not choose the all-inclusive plan but did eat dinner at Las Palapas and were again impressed. At this time of year, we did not find the place noisy at all, only occasional music wafting over from other places but not intrusive. We'd go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Playa”
Reviews.Author: SissiDee
Reviews.Content: Wow.... I wasn't expecting such a nice place! I had read some of the reviews and, as usual, relied on the most negative ones to have a genuine idea of the place. Well, I'm happy I did because I couldn't agree less with the negative reviews. In fact, I was more than pleasantly surprised. Yes, there were a few glitches but, overall, this hotel is absolutely fabulous. I was travelling solo and didn't want to stay at a big resort because as a single woman, I was concerned I would stand out among all the couples, groups of friends and families that usually go to large resorts. So, I was looking for a small boutique hotel where I would not feel overwhelmed by the size of the place and close enough to a sizeable town where I could escape to shop when I would feel a bit lonely. At the same time, I didn't want such a small hotel that I would not feel safe at night. Las Palapas is located at the end of Avenido 5 far enough not to be in the action but close enough (not even a 5 min walk) from all the action. It is right on the beach which is absolutely GORGEOUS and clean. The cabanas and rooms are all scattered in a jungle-like garden which at night is dimly and gives an eerie air to the place. My room was spotless throughout my stay. Breakfast is plentiful and delicious. The staff was very attentive, caring and nice. Unlike other guests, I did not find any of the staff inappropriate or disengaged. In fact, I would say that the only sour faces I saw were the tourists. I mean some of them could hardly make eye when you met them and this is a small place so you tend to meet everyone a few times.. I mean, we're on vacation for Pete's sake!!! No wonder the nice Mexican staff can feel a bit intimidated at times and might be led to believe that the tourists just want to be left alone... I reserved through the Morgan hotels website since this property seems to be part of that group. I had to give the reservation central a call to clear up something and the first person I spoke with did not even know that Las Palapas was part of their group. Rather than offering to assist me, she said that I should call the hotel directly. Thankfully I was transferred to this person's supervisor who was extremely helpful in assisting me. However, like some of past reviews, I must say that the music emanating from the beach club nxt door can be a bit bothersome... It usually stops around 7:00 pm but on weekends it can last much longer. If you can, ask for a room on the other side of the resort (the one adjacent to Mahekal Hotel). At night, the music in the lobby was very loud and rock and roll which I felt was too bad. Mexican music is so nice and we can now find very loungy mexican artists. Given the Boutique allure of the place, I found that disco and dance music was not the best of choices for this place... Alas, just like I had read in some of the reviews, my sheets were stained with blood. This last point has to be resolved by Las Palapas management because it can be very disturbing especially when you pay 185$ a night... Oups, one last point : prices for the food is a bit expensive (although the food is very good). 20$ for fajitas is uncalled for in Mexico...

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Klaw46
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Las Palapas with your children and extended family every year since 2003. It's the best kept secret in Playa del Carmen. The staff , Willie, Juan, Alberto, Manuel, Vincente and of course Pierre the general manager are the best! The service can't be beat anywhere in the world. We always look forward to the wonderful buffet breakfast in the morning. Everything is so fresh! The rooms are charming and we love that there are no phones nor televisions. If you are looking for a real get away with impeccable service and attention to detail, Las Palapas is the place! The Law Family

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic quiet little hotel. Beautiful cabañas, garden and access to beach”
Reviews.Author: jj33mm
Reviews.Content: Great: Beautiful gardens and beach access, cabañas with private porch with hammocks, very enjoyable and relaxing. Great breakfast and dinner once a week in the beach. Fantastic walking access to Quinta Avenida restaurants and nightlife. We were worried about the noise (as per some comments here) but there is really not so much to worry about. Music from Beach Club nearby stops early (10pm??) and at least from our room or the swimming pool or beach was not disturbing at all. Friendly and helpful service. Not so great: The beach got a bit crowded at times with people from outside the hotel...but hey, you are right in Playa del Carmen!

Reviews.Title: “Total tranquility, beauty with lots of fun just steps away!"”
Reviews.Author: SandieinWNC
Reviews.Content: Look at an aerial map of the main strip of Playa del Carmen and you will see buildings... except where Las Palapas is. There you will see tropical gardens, trees and nature tucked between the beautiful beach and exciting strip of Fifth Avenue. It is at the north end of Playa del Carmen where the best restaurants are steps away. The individual palapas make you feel as if you're on a tropical island (Bora Bora?) but just a few hours from home by plane. Staff is very warm and helpful, not a stuffy place but a relaxed home. Breakfast is included and became our breakfast and lunch as it was huge and delicious with different made-to-order selections daily. Loads of fresh fruit, side items, juices. Amazing and we felt like we were leaving friends when we left. Love it. Back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Low-stress holiday in the most beautiful place with the friendliest folks.”
Reviews.Author: g-selle
Reviews.Content: The grounds of Las Palapas are stunning - and not in a marble floor/chandalier/lighted fountain kind of way. In the most natural way: lush greenery, new flowers blossoming every day, singing birds and peeking lizards (but no mosquitoes!), natural shade and the soothing sound of palm trees in the breeze overhead at all times. Our room was perfect - roomy, breezy, filled by the sound of the Carribbean Sea. It was hard to roll out of the hammock, except that we were either going to a fantastic breakfast (included) or to sit under a palapas on the beach. White sandy beach, clearest blue sea, and really, really, really good fresh frozen margaritas made right on the beach for us. Las Palapas is close enough to Playa del Carmen's lively 5th Ave. to walk to dinner every night, but tucked away in such a pretty green space as to feel isolated once back at the hotel. Everyone at the hotel is friendly and helpful. Never ingratiating, and never rude. I recommend this place to anyone traveling to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “great getaway in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: toni1056
Reviews.Content: I would definitely come back to this hotel again. Each room is like a little cabana so it was almost like you had your own little house. There was no tv in the room, but that was fine since you shouldn't be watching tv indoors anyway. Each cabana comes with 2 hammocks so you can lounge out there when you're not on the beach. The beach and water was very nice and clean. Not too crowded since you're not in the dead center of activity. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Free drinks for ladies from 2-3pm on the beach. Right outside the complex is where all the shops, restaurants, and bars are so you're never bored at night. Felt very safe here as well. overall a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy for us.”
Reviews.Author: jasper65
Reviews.Content: We have just spent two nights at this hotel. It would appeal to beach lovers and is an excellent location for exploring the town. The noise in the afternoons was just too much for us especially as my husband was ill, it was like being in a nightclub. The music only stops once the sun goes down. We were in an upstairs cobana and as soon as it gets light the birds start and due to the nature of the building there is no soundproofing. I could even hear the man in the next cobana yawning. Breakfasts were good and the service was attentive. Beds are hard and the cobana we were in was not level so felt like we were walking up hill to get to the bathroom. We wouldn't stay again but if you are a beach lover it might be a good choice. We were told it had wireless but it never worked as the signal strength was too low so I had to use the computers in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend the day at the beach even if you're not staying there.”
Reviews.Author: Sipis
Reviews.Content: We didn't actually stay there but we got a day pass for 150 pesos to use all of the facilities. The best part about it was that the entrance fee was used as a consumption credit for drinks and food once you were there. This was a much better value than most of the other places we found. The stretch of beach was beautiful and the pool was great. However, who needs a pool when you have the carribean beach in front of you? The place offered a free drink special for girls in bikinis from 2-3 everyday. The staff didn't seem to know about it, despite signs everywhere so you have to make sure you remind them. We also recommend that you order the ceviche tostadas which were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and nice location!”
Reviews.Author: kansascity000
Reviews.Content: The grounds of Las Palapas are truly beautiful with winding paths and vegetation. Each unit has a patio or a balcony with hammocks--ours looked over a small private lawn area with birds singing in the morning. The waiters and other personnel are really terrific--very friendly and fun. The gorgeous Casa Club which, unfortunately, was pretty empty, is a great place for drinks and food. It is open (and very cool one evening so take a jacket.) The shaded (or not) beach area is one of the best we've seen and the beach bar area is great. Also a beautiful pool area but most people head for the beach. The only negatives were the Christmas Eve buffet which cost $50 and should have been under $20--very disappointing buffet. Drinks/wine extra too. . Would suggest signage in the lobby area promoting the great Casa Club and also some music there would help draw people. The adjoining beach club has an incessant drum beat but they turn it off in the evening--and you don't usually pay much attention to it. The location is great--beautiful driveway into the property just off 5th Avenue which has many restaurants/bars and shops. The northern end of 5th Avenue has more upscale businesses than the lower end tho it is fun to walk the length of 5th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - too loud”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTraveler16
Reviews.Content: For the value, I feel like I shouldn't complain much. The people that worked there were incredibly nice and the included breakfasts were great. The beach was pristine. My issue has to do with the amount of noise being generated by both the hotel and Mamacitas club (see other 3-star review about this- still completely accurate except they seem to end when the sun sets which in winter was about 5:30). I don't know whether it's an area thing or cultural thing but I would so MUCH RATHER to hear the natural sounds of the birds and the ocean than booming much. Plus one night the hotel hosted a private holiday party in the middle of the resort which went until 11:30pm and was unescapable. I had requested a quiet room, in part because I'm pregnant and knew that sleep is valuable. However there is no escaping the noise and unless you are someone who can sleep through anything OR plan on clubbing yourself, this is not the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Best family summer trip!”
Reviews.Author: Mluca9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very family oriented, a couple of blocks from 5th avenue. We stayed here for seven nights along with our toddler. Our room was outstanding and the service was excellent and at a very affordable price which included breakfast. Already, we cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on earth. There are no words to describe it.”
Reviews.Author: Pauline011
Reviews.Content: This is the most incredible place I have ever been. It is indeed paradise. The beaches so white they are blinding, the sea so clear you cannot stay away. It is not as commercial as Cancun and neither is it overloaded with Americans. It is also more traditional so ticked all the boxes for us. The people are the friendliest in the world and the women are all stunning. I'm not bad but my goodness, I felt inferior! This hotal is right on the beach and the rooms are all seperate little houses / palapas, where the balconies have two hammocks and are secluded by jungle plants. The rooms are luxury and the customer service is excellent, where he lady on reception is always happy to help. We locked ourselves out of our room 3 times in one night and she was so kind and understanding as we'd had a lot of tequila and she just thought it was funny although we were mightily embarassed! The breakfat is devine, catering for all tastes, even Glasweigen ones as there's a man frying eggs to whichever way you like them! I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel. The check-out time is afternoon and the cleaners are not intrusive. The food and cocktails are amazing and I cannot wait to go back. Thankyou, Las Palapas for making my first trip outside Europe the most incredible of my life. I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Las Palapas es Estrellamendas!”
Reviews.Author: queenswahoo
Reviews.Content: Well, maybe that is a made up word but my girlfriend and I had a fabulous time here. It was the off-season and, yes, there was some rain, but the Las Palapas made it all worthwhile. We swam in the ocean on the best private beach in the area, enjoyed daily Feliz Hora at their Beach Bar, where the bartenders were very friendly and helpful. Just 5 minutes walk puts you in the main street of Playa Del Carmen - very close but also far enough to feel relaxing and resort-like. We loved especially our friends Willy, Juan and Faustino who welcomed us every morning to the wonderful (complimentary) American breakfast buffet and close us out every night at happy hour. Always they had a smile for us. It seemed many regulars come here Internationally and they stay at least a week as we got to know our compatriots over our stay.....the atmosphere is quiet and relaxing with the Palapas and the grounds kept very clean. We will definitely return! Jennifer

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway weekend Spot in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: BibiMiami
Reviews.Content: We decided for a relaxing get away 3-day weekend, and Las Palapas Hotel in Playa del Carmen offered exactly what we were looking for! The hotel is a little oasis in the heart of playa, the rooms (casitas) are well appointed and comfortable, great staff service and the location cannot get any better! If you want a taste of Playa del Carmen, in a resort that is still intimate and nicely located, Las Palapas Hotel is the place to go!!

Reviews.Title: “Wake up in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Tipgirl
Reviews.Content: Although this is also a hotel with all inclusive guests (lots of Swiss and French), I love it particularly because you can book bed and breakfast (which is fabulous, all the fresh fruit you can imagine) and dine out in Playa. If you book an oceanside bungalow, you fall asleep and wake up with the sound of the waves. Imagine in the morning, walking out of your room in pristine white sand and taking a dip in the turquoise ocean. What a treat. The bungalows are scattered in a sweeping tropical garden. Everything is very well kept, very clean, and the staff is helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Las Palapas is the perfect resort for true Rest and Relaxation in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: maggiechicago83
Reviews.Content: A good friend and I stayed at Hotel Las Palapas two weeks ago and had the best time at this enchanting little resort. The staff was so friendly and the location is amazing! They are just a five minute walk from the heart of Playa del Carmen, and are situated right on the beautiful ocean! This is the perfect place for anyone looking for rest and relaxation with the perfect mix of nightlife right outside the resort's front door. I highly recommend this resort to anyone heading to Playa del Carmen. I already can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Just the best hotel for a great relax and peaceful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Pelucita
Reviews.Content: My husband and me were loking for a relaxing vacations, a nice room walking distance from beach, adn a lot of peace.. well you can find every thing here! We really liked this place because is like a real contact with mexico, the staff is very kind and cheerful, the "palapa room" was very nice and cozy, you stay away form artificial luxory resorts where "how much you have is how well they trat you", here is really different.. is like.. being at home away from home. The beach is big and beautiful! and there is plenty of place to sit and relax. We took the diving lessons there, with a company thay is in the beach of the Palapas hotel and it was great. The hotel is so near from the bus station, so we walked form the hotel to the bus station and trveled to every where in playa del carmen, Tulum, chichenitza, excarte, xel-ha.... by the way.. do not buy any tour in the street.. just go to the bus station and ask for any place you want to go.. they have great tours and deals at the bus station, and you will save more than 200%. And do not let seller to cheat you inviting you to "have a meal" while they show you a "new hotel".. they just want to sell you a lot of expensive thing that you so not need, and they will really make you to have a very very bad time and waste a whole day.. do not do it please! ok.. back to the hote las palapas....The breakfast is delicious! and if they do not have something yoy like they will try to get it for you. We were very happy! It´s definetly a great place for honeymoon , or to enjoy with your partner. This hotel is great, be

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Voidman
Reviews.Content: This is a really fun place. The beach is excellent. We also enjoyed the bar with the pool table and ping pong. We would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: atontao
