Reviews.Content: no tv at the cabanna. what for? the seaside was 30 metres away.... excellent breakfast, superb servide, good dinner. prices are not cheap, but.... what on earth? my cabanna was 30 metres away from the seaside. you have to pay that if you want to watch tv, there a tv cabana always emprty... nobody in this hotel cares about tv and if you walk 4 minutes, you are are playa del carmen quinta avenida, with dozens of restaurants, shops and bars the beach at the hotel is good other services (cleaning timetable, some better maintainance of the huge facilities - the hotel is rahter a group of cabins in the jungle rather than a standard hotel - could be appreciated, but can assume the efforts of the property to keep this asset against the several-thousand-rooms-allinclusive-resorts around. i would never change this cozy hotel by those resorts

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed Las Palapas”
Reviews.Author: Larry C
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The grounds were clean, well maintained and beautiful. Lots of little animals around. If you don't like the sound of birds waking you up in the morning, don't go ! The beds were hard which was to my liking but not my wifes. The breakfast buffet was incredible. Lots to eat and good !! We also enjoyed the Mariachi night. Excellent entertainment. Food was good too. It was a 20 min to 30 min walk down the beach to the beginning of 5th ave and the ferry terminal. Beautiful beaches. The walk down 5th ave was nice too with many shops and restaurants.5th ave is right up the hotel driveway. Prices varied. Wine prices varied from 12 bucks a glass to 3. 50 US(house wine). Check it out before you enter. Our beach was beautiful as the palapas and always lots of lounges available. Beach was cleaned daily when we were there.The beach bar was fine. We loved the main dining area as wll as the lovely bar and lounge on the grounds. We have no complaints. We barely heard Mamasitas. Perhaps because we were situated the farthest from it on the grounds. Did not bother us. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We will certainly return and await the day. Rumours still abound about it being bulldozed and replaced with condos in the future. Hope that doesn't happen as it has become one of our favourite hotels. We were in one of the multi room units(5 units) and would recommend paying the extra for your own beach cabana but we had not complaints about where we were. BTW, no phone or TV was a treat for us !! Larry

Reviews.Title: “Beach Paradise”
Reviews.Author: allygimp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 day trip to Playa del Carmen. We stayed at Las Palapas and it was WONDERFUL!! The property is absolutely charming. You have to understand that this is not a typical SHINY BEACH RESORT. You have to want to experience Playa del Carmen for what it has to offer....amazing beaches and the most beautiful turquoise water anywhere. The property feels very far away from the hustle of 5th avenue (even though it is a short walk). We enjoyed seeing iguanas and an animal we have yet to identify on our morning walk to Starbucks (about 5 minutes on 5th). We arrived on a Wednesday and stayed through Sunday. The only day we didn't thoroughly enjoy was Saturday afternoon. There is constant loud, repetitive base from the loud music they play at Mamitas Beach Club next door. We stayed in a beachfront bungalow (#3) which is on the opposite side of Mamitas and the sound was very tolerable...just a little annoying. If you want a great, no frills beach vacation this is the place! We are planning to return next year same time!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to vacation with friends”
Reviews.Author: jamespmccormick
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at Las Palapas, and it was great. The staff was friendly, the location was relaxing, and the and the grounds were beautiful. Rooms Las Palapas gets its name from the palm thatched roofs on the rooms and buildings. It was really cool going to sleep every night looking up into the thatchwork above us, and the roofs give the resort a very authentic Caribbean feel. We had one of the second floor rooms set back from the ocean a bit, surrounded by rainforest, so we often saw tropical birds and little geckos in the trees out our windows (and heard them as a morning "wake-up call"). When you book your room, you might be able to request if you want one closer to the beach or tucked into the rainforest near the resort enterance. All of the rooms appeared to have a patio with hammocks, and ours also had a couple chairs outside as well. Although the room had air conditioning, we were able to just open the windows and turn on the fan to let the fresh ocean breeze in. Bottled water was provided, but the tap water is actually safe to drink as well. Grounds The grounds are really beautiful, blending from rainforest up front to white sandy beach and palm trees on the shore. The layout has winding sidewalks and vegetation throughout, resulting in a cozy, natural landscape. You can't even see the resort buildings from the ocean. There's also a nature trail and lookout tower on the property that are definitely worth checking out. The lookout tower is a bit hard to find, but worth the short hike for the view. The dirt nature trail is a quick hike that leads you through undeveloped rainforest. We saw several cenotes along the way, as well as several raccoon-like animals called tehones. Make sure you put on some bugspray before you go! Amenities The resort has a great beach with free beach chairs and palapa umbrellas. There's a watersports shop on the beach that has things like scuba diving and jet skis. We did two scuba dives with Emelio while we were there and enjoyed both of them. There's a beach bar that has a one-hour two-for-one happy hour every evening (I think 5-6), and the lounge in the middle of the grounds has its happy hour right after that (6-7). (Be sure to put bugspray on your legs for the beach bar happy hour.) We really enjoyed the onsite restaurant. It had a great all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet that included Mexican breakfast items, fruit, and an omelet station. We usually ate out on 5th Avenue for dinner (I highly recommend Yaxche), but we did eat at the resort one night when they had a mariachi band playing. Apparently they have that every Sunday, along with other themes other nights of the week. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed Las Palapas and will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Las Palapas was Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: mandctravel
Reviews.Content: If you want to relax by the beach in a not all inclusive resort come to LP the first impression from the hotel we had was that maybe it could be a little to rustique and small for our taste, we used to stay in big all inclusive hotels but this time we wanted to try something diferent and it was great. After we spend the first night we realized that our choice was the right one. the location from LP is perfect, one side from the hotel you have the 5ta avenida wich is the most known street in Playa del Carmen and on the other side you have one of the better beaches in town. a lot of guest complain about mamitas the beach club next door, we know that sometimes techno music is not the favorite from all, but you just have to choose the right dates to come and after all, the music isn´t that loud and it stops after the sun goes down. definitley one of the best places to stay in Playa

Reviews.Title: “Best Beach in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: 2dkdkd
Reviews.Content: Everyone told me Playa del Carmen would be great, and they were right . What no one told me is the huge difference of beaches north of the pier vs. south of the pier. The hotels closest to downtown are south - and between the rocks and fishing boats you CANNOT go in the water there. This means everyone has to travel north to use the picture perfect beaches just north of the pier, making them more crowded. Las Palapas is at the north end of the north side, so it has a perfect beach, umbrellas and a bar in the least crowded place. The only drawback was the hard bed, but our stay was so relaxing we didn't mind. We were thrilled with our cute little Palapa, the beautiful grounds and the proximity to downtown. It was a short walk to the busy downtown, but far enough away to avoid the noise once we got back and wanted to relax (aside from the beach club next door but they stopped around 6PM). I stumbled upon this little gem by complete accident but I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Jungle beach resort with swaying palms on white sugar sand with Goati's-monkey like animal- on property.”
Reviews.Author: TaTaadventures
Reviews.Content: It was wonderful...treated excellent by staff!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Dream vacation...located in the best part of Playa Del Carmen town, ferry over to Cozumel was easy to find. We had great food must try "fresh fish cooked in banana leaves", FANTASTIC, ask Willy the cooks manager at resort! And the Pina Colada-we called it "coco bongo drinks" by Damein at resort a must try, EXCELLENT! Fantastic diving, single or couple massage on beach-a walk to go left of resort, fire show at Parrot Club down town, Coco Bongo entertainment in town, excellent beach-quiet or walk to busier area, turquoise blue shades of water, etc... We met the manager of the resort, Pierre from Switzerland and he was very nice, beautiful family, thank you for the wonderful stay! Hope to see you again soon...;-) ;-) Mr. & Mrs. Meier

Reviews.Title: “2nd time around...”
Reviews.Author: stickyTex
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have been twice in 3 years to LP, and I actually think our second stay last week was better. It seems the 1st visit the area was still reeling from a hurricane, and the grounds were in a state of shock. But this time the grounds were outstanding, very well manicured, and full of all sorts of lush tropical vegetation. Our room was as expected, no frills and very clean, we booked a standard garden and got a 2nd level, we had enough privacy and spent much time on the patio. Yes, the beds are hard, but after a few beers, passing out never felt so good. The bathroom was standard, plenty of vanity space, the toilet had a privacy wall that literally was in your face and on your knees, but the shower, no tub in ours, was fantastic, plenty of hot water and great pressure. So the room was spot on to our expectations. The beach area was a little crowded probably due to the slow erosion from the waves(which were huge), but was very relaxing and fun to people watch, plenty of lounges and palapas to use, and a beach bar area right there. I would highly recommend the breakfast buffet, it's not over the top crazy with food and variety, but just simple and to the point, with fresh breads, juices and eggs. And with the service you cant go wrong. As far as dinner goes we only ate it once, it was a mexican buffet that was all right. But breakfast is a must. Over all we enjoyed the resort and the people who operate it, no issues with service from the front desk to the beach area. It's a great place to get away and relax EXCEPT: About 50 yards down south on the beach, there's a beach club by the name of "MAMITAS" , this is where all the " trust-fund, never worked a day in our life ' younger crowd goes. This place is such a waste of space, numerous beds littering the beach with full bottles of booze and champagne being served to excess. The DJ seems to have 1 song in his repertoire, and it's bass beat is played to mind numbing levels, possibly heard in Cuba. Granted the music didnt play all day, but from around 2pm on, grab the ear plugs. Would we go back to LP ? Yes, we would... stickyTex

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: kboyken
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Hotel Las Palapas. The place is north of the heart of the tourist area of Playa del Carmen, at the end of a winding street down a hill, so it's somewhat secluded, but within walking distance of all the touristy restaurants and shops. The hotel staff were friendly and efficient. They helped us book a tour down to Tulum. We enjoyed our cabana, on a side path near the small store on the grounds. I loved lounging in one of the hammocks on the porch. The cabana was clean and comfortable. Breakfast is included in the price of a room, and we also had dinner at the hotel a couple times during our stay. The meals were served buffet-style and were delicious. There were always a variety of dishes, some Mexican, some not. My wife and I got massages while we were at Las Palapas. My wife got the relaxation massage, which she thoroughly loved. I got a deep tissue massage, and it hurt so good! The beach at Las Palapas is not as busy or crowded as the area closer to downtown Playa. The sand was beautiful--I was amazed at how clean the beach was up and down the coast, given the number of people using it. The hotel had many guests from Germany, Italy, and France, and our neighbors were from Argentina. My wife and I really enjoyed the international flavor of the hotel. The only negative things I would have to say about Las Palapas are that in the evenings, there was always loud music. This didn't bother my wife and I very much--we slept really well every night. But I can see where it might bother some people. Also, my wife lost a pair of earrings while we stayed, and despite alerting the staff, they were never found. You never know under what circumstances something might be lost, but it did leave a little bit of a sour taste to an otherwise very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for nature and beach loving deaf people”
Reviews.Author: caribean_fan15
Reviews.Content: We stayed on this wonderfully and lovely hotel the second time, after we had great experience the last year but earlier and not between Christmas and New Year. Also this year we had absolutely friendly and perfect services in restaurants, cabanas, and so one. Nothing was bad, just one: The beach club nearby around 100 meter distance, all cabanas had this experience in this timeframe. And almost all guest I spoke was over nervous, and say that is not relaxing time there. Daily loud monotone pop music or more seldom popular disco music starting around 11 30 AM and ends at 08:00 PM, Earplugs (given from the receptions) helped du reduce, but the bass you can feel with the belly… But some days was much more extreme we had to go away, the build 5 days a special stage on the beach for the annual beach D J festival and other with loudspeaker and amplifier in summery 15 000 Watt, 12x 1200 Watt Bass and the same power middle tone, yes is true I have checked by myself , No earplugs can help for reduce significantly, also in the night….than… thinking at was ending (given by written hotel information) at midnight was wrong, the generator runs the first 2 days the whole night, and was a kind of turbines I feel I sleeping next to the airport, nothing really nothing can help… The other days was replaced with a softer Diesel…. The earplugs helping these days for having some sleep on the very hard beds. Sorry for the wonderfully Hotel but its need to warn other to trap in this experiences too.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic, some charm, some problems, and way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: flying_about
Reviews.Content: Both Las Palapas and Shangri-La are older places. They are similar, close to each other, both a short walk to town. While the rooms in Las Palapas are nicer and cleaner, neither one should cost as much as it does !!! They overcharge because the consumer pays, and evidently could not care less that these rates have gone above and beyond what is reasonable. These are old style casual beach vacation places without TVs, phones, fridges in the rooms. I really have to laugh when hearing that such a place is called a resort. The word resort should be defined, because not every old little beach property is a resort, for sure. For example, the rooms in these cabanas are not quiet. The thatched roofs and wood shutters in lieu of windows may be cute and original, but you hear all the noise of the neighborhood. If you are lucky, you hear the waves, but more likely, all kinds of other noises such as radios, parties, sirens, and neighbors. At a two star level, you can't expect all housekeeping staff to speak English. The confusion probably is there because this place is not overrated, but over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: reemoorg
Reviews.Content: Okay, after many months of anxiety on where stay and gambling on Las Palapas all I can say is wow. The place is awesome. The views are unreal and the beach is picture perfect. You will not regret staying here. The only negative is the beds. My gosh they are incredibly hard and uncomfortable. Other that that it is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: jodydelia
Reviews.Content: This may not be a large, shining resort but the location and grounds is so ideal it is quite easy to put up with any small inconviences. Nestled in the jungle and touching a beautiful beach it is just a five minute walk to the action of fifth avenue. We went to 5th every day and night and the beach. The morning breakfast was as perfect as it gets. Get the standard room, skip the half board. Waking up in the morning from the cabanas to the sound of birds and seeing all the tropical foilage truly is special. This is not a crowded place. While the european girls at the front desk was a little snooty the mexican staff in all areas was very friendly and responsive. It is sad that this place will be torn down next year and replaced with another resort like the rest....

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons of Las Palapas”
Reviews.Author: AnnTag
Reviews.Content: First impression of the hotel was not a good one by any means. The first room that we were given had a very strong odor of mold & mildew. The staff was very responsive when we requested a new room. Grounds are very nice at Las Palapas and the rooms are clean with the exception of the linens. In both rooms the sheets and towels were stained. I personally do not want a pillow case with someone else's old mascara on it. Neither my husband or I were comfortable with the level of cleanliness with the linens. Nice walking distance to town for dinner and shopping. The hammocks for the porch are a nice touch. Beach is nice but much too crowded and there is a very very loud music venue next door, not very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Palapas”
Reviews.Author: chefivy
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place! The grounds are set in a near-jungle with beautiful plantings. The beach is lovely, with plenty of chairs and shade, the palapas rooms have authentic palm roofs and plenty of space, and the staff are just fantastic. (Ask Obaldo at the bar where to eat real Mexican food). Another plus is that Las Palapas is on the North end of the main drag, so you're not quite as submerged in the Playa party scene. My only complaint is that there is a beach club next door, so you can hear the pounding dance music from about 11am to 5pm everyday. It's not bad on the beach, but in the rooms (on the south side of the hotel grounds) it really gets annoying. Otherwise, we loved it. What a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Sun & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: tanner30
Reviews.Content: We found Las Palapas to be everything and more. It was very quiet, great beach and all the staff were very helpful and friendly. Nice beach and a great little gym. Within easy walking distance to downtown to sightsee. Rooms were clean, not super flashy but comfortable, hammocks on the deck are a great feature. Overall it was a great holiday, birds in the morning are great to wake up to. Sorry to see that it is going under construction, it really is a treasure. Campbell River, BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay, avoid the dinner”
Reviews.Author: ob234
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Las Plapas. overall we were disappointed. While the rooms are nice and clean, and the service was cordial, the hotel gave off an 'old' feel, and we kept bumping into unpleasant little surprises such as unclean restrooms in the restaurant, and having to sign for the beach towells and the A/C remote. One clear conclusion - avoid the half board option. The dinner is very disappointing (a reheated TV dinner with some sad sauce) and Playa has plenty of wonderful restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “pretty beach and we loved our rooms”
Reviews.Author: cyntia
Reviews.Content: Las Palapas was quiet and charming with lovely rooms and a lot of european guests. We stayed in the garden area and not on the beach but we enjoyed the flowers and foliage. At sunrise a huge chorus of songbirds started up the day. Our rooms were spacious, well furnished and beautiful, very clean, lots of hot water, beds not the best, though, on the hard side, and a mosquito or two at night. At times we woke up at the sound of wildlife rustling around on the thatched roof. (Cats, monkeys, raccoons?) We dont like air conditioning - you can't hear the sea at night - and found the ceiling fans kept the rooms very comfortable at night. Our thatched roof terrace outside the room had comfortable furniture as well as a pair of hammocks in which to spend the late afternoon hours while recovering from the day's sun and getting ready to go out at night. Garden villas had no sea view but were much more private than the beach villas. Songbirds stray cats and a coatimundi that roamed around seemed to be our only neighbors . Although other villas were nearby the foliage was so lush you couldn't see them. The beach itself was beautiful but busy and noisy with a huge soundstage next door and music blaring until late at night on Saturday night. The other days were more peaceful with an interesting mix of vacationing euros, norteamericanos, mexican families and locals keeping things lively. Great swimming with a bit of a surf and the beach dive shop personnel were wonderful. Dinner at Las Palapa was a good value but uninspiring and we ate out most nights on Avda.Quinta. Breakfasts were very good and the service everywhere in the hotel friendly and helpful. We stayed only four nights but managed a trip to Akumal where there was good snorkling with sea turtles abundant, and a long swim out to the reef made us earn the great lunch (fish tacos) served at the beach restaurant Lol-Ha. We also snorkled in a pretty cenote - Cenote Krisitalina - with caves to explore and small cliff you could jump/dive off. We took the collectivos - mini-vans that go between Playa and Tulum - to get to both places, and they were very efficient and much cheaper than taxis. Also full of local people as well as tourists. We were very pleasantly surprised by Playa's night life. We dont do discos and avoid bars full of drunken cruise-ship types but found sophisticated watering holes (some way too expensive), upscale tequila bars, good live music, and a night scene that rivaled anything on Miami's South Beach. Avenida Quinta is a very short walk from the quiet peace of Las Palapas with blocks and blocks of good restaurants in all price ranges, live music, and the inevitable rows of jewelry stores. All in all the trip was a nice balance of beach, nature and buena comida. Had our best meal at Mayan restaurant Yaxche, and enjoyed the huge "cave" bar Alux . Staff at the reception desk at Las Palapas were never in a hurry but did well by us and were always friendly and warm.

Reviews.Title: “too good to be true”
Reviews.Author: ricky123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Las Palapas for one week and I can honestly say it was one of the best holidays we have had. It is hard to put down all the qualities of this admirable hotel but here are just a few. We had a garden suite deluxe room that was like waking up in the jungle canopy each morning, scrupulously clean , comfy bed and trust me we are fussy. The freindliest staff from the efficient front desk to the tireless garden crew. The garden is awork of art in itself complete with coatamundis and songbirds.We asked for a fridge and extra pillows on arrival one round of pina coladas later and they were delivered. The food was always good and the buffet breakfast had truly wonderful omellettes and crispy bacon to die for. All this and I havent mentioned the beach , a picture post card location with loungers and thatched sun shades to spare. If you want winter sun and a casual but professional place to stay within easy reach of a vibrant beach resort move quickly and book las palapas before it closes in August.

Reviews.Title: “We had our wedding here and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jenshana
Reviews.Content: We chose Las Palapas as our destination wedding site because we heard the beach was the best--we were not disapointed! We stayed five nights and loved having the beach so close. The grounds are amazing. The rooms weren't as bad as I had heard, but when the rain came they did get a little damp. I thought the (free) breakfast was great and the food for the wedding reception was really good, too. I really missed Las Palapas when we left for our honeymoon. I truly had a wonderful experience and would recommend Las Palapas for as long as it stays around. I also loved Playa del Carmen-- it was the perfect destination for a destination wedding. It has something for everyone-- relaxation and pampering, great nightlife and fun activities and adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous gorgeous place, perfect for a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: gruffalo58
Reviews.Content: Wow. This place is completely breath-takingly gorgeous - if this happens to be your type of thing. If you tend to opt for huge purpose-built all-inclusives, then this probably will not appeal - as the key words here are quiet, intimate and brimming with character. THE LOCATION: Las Palapas is located relatively centrally in Playa Del Carmen (it is dead easy to get into the main town - no more than a five minute leisurely stroll). However, it is far enough removed that you will experience no noise at all. Playa Del Carmen itself is relatively nice, though don't count on getting any bargain souveniers - all the prices are hoiked up considerably as it is a tourist resort. Same goes for food. Playa literally consists of one major strip of shops that runs for 5km; it is nice enough to walk down, though you will get harrassed slightly by shop owners desperate for you to have a look in their shop! LAS PALAPAS FACILITIES: Las Palapas has a really nice restaurant, though personally, I would advise going out and eating in town at night for a bit of variation! The restuarant, like all the buildings in Las Palapas, has a gorgeous straw roof, which when lit at night is very atmospheric. They also do a GREAT breakfast in the morning, choice from yoghurts, fruit, breads, cheese, ham, plus hot choices like omelette made how you like it and Mexican traditional fare such as refried beans! The bar is also great - check out happy hour - two cocktails for the price of one. This works out such good value - and their margaritas are very nice. The bar also does good lunches that are reasonably priced and you get lots of free tortilla chips with it to keep you full up! The nicest thing about the bar, is late at night, the racoons and the coatis run round it to see if there's any food going. (don't worry, they won't come near you, but it is cool to see them!) There is a small beach bar too and a shop to buy souveniers in (again, overpriced) and a library area, where you can borrow books that other people have left behind. The swimming pool is of an ok size, perfectly good enough to have a dip and is nicely secluded. THE ROOMS: The rooms are relatively basic, but this is part of their character. Be warned though, the beds are HARD. I had trouble sleeping a few nights. You will get a lot of mosquitos as well, so bring necessary preventative measures! The rooms generally have the lovely straw roofs and you also get two hammocks, which is by far and away the best thing, nothing beats swinging in a hammock reading a book! THE BEACH: The beach is only a few seconds walk from some of the rooms, and is beautiful, as you would expect for this part of the world - white sands, lush clear blue sea, palm trees, gorgeous. There is a dive centre right next door if you fancy a go at that as well! In summary, I recommend this place totally. I went there for my honeymoon, and we had such a lovely time. We even loved it despite hurricane dean turning up in the middle (causing us to be evacuated to the far less pleasant Moon Palace for four days!) This is a warning I would give you, especially if you are from the UK and not familiar with hurricanes: travel agents will NOT mention this to you, but it is very common to get hurricanes, right from august through to November. Don't worry too much though, the Mexicans certainly don't - they are totally used to it! If you like places with character and peace and quiet with goregeous settings, las palapas will probably do the job!

Reviews.Title: “A piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: leilaTO
Reviews.Content: Also I stayed at Las Palapas during Hurricane Dean,and they handled the situation very well and with calm! The hotel is simply spectacular!Who wants big resorts with AI,they're allover!Places like this make the difference! There's still that magical Caribbean atmosphere that's difficult or probably impossible to find elsewhere in Riviera Maya! I'm really sad for what's gonna happen to this piece of paradise!And whatabout all the animals in the gardens and jungle? All the lovers of Las Palapas should make together a movement called "Save Las Palapas"!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly rooms, unfriendly stuff but nice location”
Reviews.Author: mexico80
Reviews.Content: Our cabana (garden category) smelled awful thats why we left after three days instead of staying six as planned, the garden is beautiful, the beach also. The personel in the beach bar and in the restaurant are very friendly but in reception I was tempted to apologize for being a guest. it would be tolerable but for that smell- I just coulndn't stay a day longer. Food is ok but not really brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Resort”
Reviews.Author: mouseyleo
Reviews.Content: Highly Recommend! But hurry. This hotel is closing in January 08, and will be torn down for condos. A real loss, because I thought it was the most charming beach front hotel in town. Description: Quiet, full of gardens, intimate, casual. Open air restaurants. Great beach (I thought the nicest on stretch just north of pier) and beautiful grounds. Has two restaurants and beach bar. Walking distance to Avienda Quinta, a mostly pedestrian shopping/restaurant district that is quite lovely at night. Rooms: Various palapa (on 2nd floor and 1 story) and non-palapa (on 1st floor) rooms. Basic, with decently sized balconies with hammocks. Clean and comfortable with A/C. I recommend the NORTH side of the property, which is a little quieter. (Construction and techno music from nearby hotel on south side.) If you get a palapa, you will enjoy the vaulted ceiling, but if you like to sleep in, be advised, the birds start chirping at the crack of dawn and can sound like they are roosting inside! Mexican beds are notoriously hard. I went to Walmart my first day and bought an egg-crate mattress for about 12 bucks that made a huge difference. Beach: Clean, wide and sea-weed free with palapas and lounge chairs. Always a lounge chair available. Also had hammocks and tables/chairs. Good swimming beach. Some toplessness, so if that makes you uncomfortable, be forewarned. Food: Breakfast buffet-style with hot foods, cereals and breads. Best meal of day. Lunch-restaurant servicable with typical American type fare and some local dishes. Dinner tended to be a bit more ambitious, but wasn't particularly veggie-friendly, so I ate out. (They were willing to accommodate any request, though.) LOTS of restaurants in walking distance. Breakfast and dinner (including tips) was included in the room price. Drinks, lunch extra. Service/Staff: So friendly and helpful. From the groundskeepers (one of which showed off the resident iguana who comes out each morning to greet the guests) to the waiters who remember you by name. I feel bad that these people will be out of work in several months. They are really great. Every request was met with a great attitude. Pool: Nice, clean, shady - not huge, with a shallower end for toddlers. Right by beach in grove of palms. Kids: I saw some kids, although the overall resort isn't geared toward them. That is, there's no activities, kids' club, etc. But the pool and beach are nice and the area has a ton of things to do. Other: *There is a fitness center and spa. *Internet is confined to 2 PCs set up in the lobby. Best for checking email, flights, short web searches, as there always seemed to be someone waiting to use them. No wi-fi at hotel, but tons of internet cafes in walking distance, including good old Starbucks, about a 10 minute walk down Avienda Quinta. *Check out the "Mirador" a lighthouse shaped building on the grounds that you can climb up and see across the property, town and to the ocean. *Also, there is a short but charming jungle path that begins in the parking lot. In the morning and evening you can see badgers, raccoons, lizards and even monkeys. *PDC now has a Walmart and Sam's Club down highway 307 if you need supplies - especially sunscreen and the other stuff you can't bring on a plane. *The closest alternative to Las Palapas on that stretch in PDC is Shangri-La Caribe (right next door), which I found in my research to be more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Love Las Palapas, sad to hear it will close in October...”
Reviews.Author: UM1997
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time at Las Palapas and 3rd time in Playa del Carmen. I have nothing but positive things to say about Las Palapas, the bungalows are comfortable and rustic, the grounds are perfectly maintained and beautiful, the beach is expansive and tranquil and the staff treats you like family. The only downside? Learning that Las Palapas has been sold and will close in October. No one there seemed to know what the new owners will do with the property, but there is certainly fear that it will be torn down and replaced with the new, modern condo buildings that are popping up all over Playa. What was once a quiet little village has now become a mini Cancun with 2 Starbucks, a Burger King, Subway, and Diesel Jeans...I guess it's time for us to find somewhere new to go to!! But back to our experience at Las Palapas. We booked 2 "garden deluxe" rooms, which are bigger than their standard rooms- a little further away from the beach but tucked into the jungle and really, really quiet. When we arrived, we were offered a suite- which is a new building just opened in November. It was a 3 bedroom apartment with a huge kitchen, dining room, balcony and living room with flat screen TV. I'm sure many people would jump at the chance to stay in a place like this, but for us, what we loved about Las Palapas was the rustic quality of the resort- little thatched roof bungalows with no TVs or telephones, so we opted to stay back at the main resort in our "garden deluxe" rooms. We chose to have the half board meal plan so we had breakfast and dinner included each day. Breakfast consisted of a buffet with fresh fruit, cereals, breads, juices, a few hot items and made to order eggs. Dinners were sit down with 2 choices of appetizer and 3 choices of entrees. There were also a few themed buffet dinners, such as the Mayan buffet on Monday, a Caribbean grilled dinner on the beach on Wednesday and a Mexican buffet on Saturday. All had live music and all of the meals were delicious. The wait staff is so friendly and really takes the time to get to know their guests. They also speak many languages and were able to talk to all of the guests with ease (I would say about 85-90% of the guests were European- German, French, Italian and English). Our days were spent at the beach where there were plenty of beach chairs and palapas to go around. I read 3 books while I was there because there is nothing to do but relax! If I wasn't reading on the beach, I was reading on my hammock on my porch- or reading in bed before I went to sleep. The resort is really quiet and peaceful so if you're looking for a crazy party place, this is definitely not it. Also, although there were a few kids around when we were there, this is not a real kid friendly kind of place, as there are no structured activities for children. It's basically the beach or the pool for kids. I highly recommend this resort for anyone who needs a quiet place to relax. It saddens me to know that Las Palapas has been sold and will close, but the Shangri-La right next door will remain open. I have been to both resorts and they pretty much are identical so if you're planning a trip after October and are looking for a quiet place to stay, look at Shangri-La.

Reviews.Title: “we were the only firstimers/perfect”
Reviews.Author: DCBigben
Reviews.Content: With great reason, we were the only people we met who were there for the first time at Las Palapas. Simply because as we will soon, they all return. The property could have 500 rooms, but choose to keep it small and preserved natural setting. beach clearly widest, cleanest, best in PDC, walk both ways and you will realize how lucky you are. do get a room close to beach, or 1/2 way btw beach and breakfast so close to both. noise from techno music never a factor that reviews said could be. construction noise could have been if you have a room on the border of 5th ave side of prop but we did not. Did not see a mosquito in the 5 days at PDC. and yes, bed hard as a rock, but we heard you could ask for a pad, we chose Marqaritas as our answer to that if you know what I mean. breakfast included, we had beers a few lunches on the beach and walked to 5th ave everynight for dinner and many great spots. big surpise at checkout, the bill was way less than we expected, and as you know that is usually t he opposite as you forget during the week what you put on the room tab. breakfast was great, staff very mellow but great. two favorite restaurants were from TA list, LaQuinta Pasion, and Bueno Aires .

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: simplee10
Reviews.Content: This was a return trip for my husband and I and this time we brought our 2 1/2 yr old along. The hotel knew that we had stayed there before and put us in the same beachfront palapa as our last visit which was thoughful! We were on the Shangri La side of the property and we did not hear any construction ever or disco music. We only heard the waves and the birds. The beds are not the most comfortable but that's to be expected. They do have portacribs available and fridges for $2/day which we recommend. The beach is amazing, beautiful, and very crowded at all times. However, the property does have enough loungers for everyone and the beach bar is very close. The pool was clean and often not occupied. Beach towels are provided and can be exchanged for clean ones when you like. The breakfast was great. Made to order omelettes or eggs, pancakes, quesadillas, pastries, bread, sausage, bacon, fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt, etc. Also, if you are planning on leaving the hotel early for an excursion and will be missing breakfast they will pack you a lunch to go. Front desk is very friendly and helpful and offers babysitting if you like. They also have condos behind the property which you can rent with all the amenities you would get if you were staying at the hotel ie. maid service, ability to use the beach, breakfast, etc. We met some great people while staying there and hope to return again someday!

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: clementinesf
Reviews.Content: This place was great! On the most gorgeous stretch of beach in Playa, nice pool, beautiful garden setting, very, very friendly and helpful staff, comfortable, cute rooms. Great place for families with children! We are planning our trip next year already!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel and Beach”
Reviews.Author: sunloveny
Reviews.Content: We just returned from six nights at Las Palapas. I was nervous after reading the last few reviews about noise, but our stay was great! The beach is wonderful and there are always enough chairs for everyone. The beach bar is great and has a nice happy hour where you can sit after the sun goes down. Food: We chose the breakfast included option. The breakfast was great, a good variety of food, all fresh. We never ate dinner at the hotel because there were so many other great restaurants along 5th. A word about the noise some people have complained about. I think we were lucky to have a room on the opposite side of the property from the condo construction and beach noise. Occasionally, on the beach you could hear some faint techno music. However, from our room (north side) you could hear nothing. We walked over to the other side of the property (near the observation tower) one day and could hear the music clearly. Also we had a garden deluxe room which I think (from talking to other guests in the beach bungalows and my own observations) are more private than the beachfront rooms. I liked the second floor room we had because you had a nice view of the property and it felt private (we were on our honeymoon). The beds were not the most comfortable I've ever had, but they were fine and we didn't have problems sleeping. Bring bug spray if you want to walk in the jungle on the property. There are a few mesquitos on the property at night, but we were warned by the staff not to venture on the jungle walk without bug spray. The walk to the observation tower is short and a nice alternative (especially if you have kids). The staff was wonderful, very helpful with anything we asked. We broke a glass one night and asked the front desk to have someone sweep the floor and in about ten minutes a maintanence person was at our door. The only complaint was that the hotel arranged for someone to pick us up at the airport and we couldn't find them when we arrived at Cancun. But that worked out fine because we had thought about taking the ADO bus, so we hopped on the bus. When we arrived at the hotel, the front desk person said "that that sometimes happens" and said the guy had called the hotel when he couldn't find us. It didn't matter to us but I would not reccomend the private service because the ADO bus is so easy (and cheap). . If you are looking for an alternative to all inclusives and crowded beaches, stay here! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and beach.”
Reviews.Author: yogimarcia
Reviews.Content: las Palapas Hotel, Playa del Carmen, Mexico December 15 - 25, 2006. A beautiful setting, lovely grounds, friendly staff, convenient to town. We moved twice during our ten day stay trying to get away from the obscenely loud music comming from neighboring resorts. We loved the beach, the dive shop operation, and the beautiful gardens and would love to return except for the pounding sound of the music.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but not the best place in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: monaP
Reviews.Content: The staff and food at this hotel were wonderful and the location can't be beat in regards to location to nightlife and dining. It is a different hotel in Playa del Carmen because of the bungalow style rooms. However, if a private,bungalow vacation is what you are looking I wouldn't recommend Playa del Carmen in the first place. If you do stay at this hotel, insist on a top floor room! Staying on the first floor of a bungalow insures that you will spend your entire vacation with the window shutters closed and spend no time on your hammock because of the complete lack of privacy on the first level. Our room was near the pool restaurant that hosts destination weddings and we spent an entire day and night of our vacation being stared at by wedding guests. We felt like we were crashing the wedding. It was awkward. But the staff did move us to a second floor room after that. Also, most of the property is surrounded by barbed wire and that very much took away from the beach and bungalow feel of the property. The beds in this place are HARD and very, very uncomfortable. The room decor is lacking and one should only plan on having breakfast at the hotel. The set menu at dinner is not good and there are amazing restaurants just steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep”
Reviews.Author: proflaw
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, our stay at this very lovely spot was fatally marred by a complete lack of sleep bought upon by evening rock concerts on the beach (that didn't end until after midnight) and construction on immediately adjacent property that began promptly at 7 am every morning. The construction noise (saws, hammers, cement mixers, etc.) rendered our room unusable for most of the day. Management responded to complaints by vaguely promising compensation, but nobody with authority to do anything was there upon check out. They also handed out earplugs and acted surprised that the noise continued well after 5pm daily and did not stop for Saturday or Sunday. [They advertise that their hotel services will be available with the new condos that are currently being constructed So they are hardly disinterested in the construction.] The rock concerts may not recur, but the construction is surely not going away. Avoid this at all costs for the forseeable future.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Toddy1981
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Palapas in May/June this year and absolutely loved it. If you are looking for somewhere a little bit different and very relaxing then you should give it a go. We went for a garden deluxe room. The only criticism of these rooms is the mosquitoes - there were quite a few as we were near running water - take lots of repellent, antihistamines etc. Perhaps there would be less mosquitoes in the non-garden rooms. The decor in the rooms is indeed rustic but that is definitely not a criticism, it was in keeping with the theme of the hotel. If you are looking for the kind of luxury you would get in a conventional 4 or 5 star hotel then go to a conventional 4 or 5 star hotel. Our favourite thing about the rooms was definitely the two hammocks on the balcony, they were brilliant. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and very well kept. Likewise the beach is lovely and as many people have stated before, probably the best in Playa Del Carmen. We went for the bed and breakfast option - breakfast was great and we never missed it! The staff are lovely, very helpful and polite, cant fault them. The hotel location is ideal, in very easy walking distance from 5th Avenue, the main strip with all the bars and restaurants. On the whole we had great, good value for money meals in Playa del Carmen. Utiiliise the list of restaurants on this webpage, the list is accurate and all the restaurants we tried were excellent. There is plenty to do in and around Playa del Carmen - we visited Coba, Tulum, Chichen Itza, Xel Ha and Xcaret. The trips are good value for money and well organised, would definitely recommend going on a few. We definitely envisage ourselves returning to Playa Del Carmen at some point and when we do, it will be to Las Palapas

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach with great staff”
Reviews.Author: JONBONSC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a four-day weekend in mid October. We originally saw this property featured in a National Geographic Traveler magazine. The hotel was scarcely occupied the days we were there, as well as the entire hotel industry in the area, so we felt that we had the run of whatever we wanted to do without much hassle. We'd been to Cancun several times, but now that we've visited Playa, we'll be coming back here whenever we visit the Yucatan. If you're looking for a more relaxed, pedestrian-friendly town, Playa fits the bill. We used the hotel's recommended taxi/car service to pick us up at the airport-- wonderful, carefree and easy! We'd recommend it to anyone. Just ask when you make your reservations. We checked in around 1 pm without any problem. The property itself was beautiful-- very eco-friendly. We saw the two monkeys that "run" the hotel while we were there :). We stayed on the second floor of a cabana-- very cool view of the thatched roof! We had a room with air conditioning...the air conditioner didn't work so well, but we were fine. The room was clean and adequate. However, if there was one drawback of this property, it would have to be the somewhat antiquated and spartan feel of the rooms. The furniture is dated, the bed linens are incredibly scratchy and the amenities are sparse-- it's okay that there's no TV or phone, but it would be nice to have at least a clock and/or a radio. The biggest annoyance was that there was hardly ever any hot water to be had-- we have a feeling that each cabana shares a tiny water tank....so take a shower when your neighbors aren't around! The hammocks are a nice touch and we found them to be nice after returning from the beach, pre-dinner time where we could enjoy a beer. That being said, you don't go to a beach front property to sit on 400 thread count sheets and order room service while you channel surf! The beach was out of this world!! Very nice beach with not too many people....clean sand that was raked every morning. Seaweed was a tiny problem-- one day there was none, the next day, it was everywhere. The hotel's beach bar served drinks at a reasonable price ($2-3 for a beer or soft drink). The beach made this property what it is. The beach is unbelievable and won't disappoint anyone. We would recommend this hotel solely based on the beach. The breakfast was great and the servers were attentive and extremely friendly. The lunch restaurant served a wide variety of dishes at very reasonable prices. The hotel makes if very easy to relax and not worry about your pocketbook if you decide to eat their food and drink their drinks-- something that doesn't happen in Cancun unless you're at an all-inclusive. One word-- this hotel caters to the European crowd, which didn't bother us. We were the only Americans on site the days we were there. If you have children, be prepared for lots of topless women. Final word is that we had a great time on the beautiful beach and found the staff's service wonderful, without reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine a better value in PDC”
Reviews.Author: JJIndy
Reviews.Content: We loved this place and will definitely be back! My wife, 9 year-old son and I stayed at Las Palapas <---> in Playa del Carmen for 6 days in late March 2006. It was our first trip to the Caribbean and their first trip outside the US. We booked it largely based on other recommendations from this site. I received an email at home several days before arrival confirming our reservation, a nice touch. Check-in was prompt. We had a second story "garden deluxe" room (cabaña #50) at the northwest corner of the property. The rooms were fairly large with two double beds (hard as expected), tiled bath with large shower (no bathtub), sitting area with wicker couch, 3 chairs, desk and coffee table. There was a small bar near the door where you could dump all your "stuff." At the back was a large sitting area with two huge hammocks and a small plastic table and two chairs. Closet space wasn't large, but adequate. No TV. A small refrigerator was delivered in about 30 minutes after we asked. The property was full of large 2 story bungalows with thatched roofs. Each bungalow appeared to have 2 cabañas per floor except for the beach-front cabañas, which stood alone, I think. Our garden room had air conditioning. It was very quiet. Even from the back of the property we still heard the ocean while lounging on the hammocks at night. The clientele was heavily European with some Aussies and Kiwis. Desk staff appeared to speak most European languages as well as English fluently. Wait staff spoke good English, but may have spoken others as well. Service staff didn't speak much English at all. Hurricane Wilma appeared to have damaged many of the palms on the property. There were ropes and stakes supporting many of the remainng trees. The beach front trees in the web site pictures appear much denser than they are now. That being said, there were no other visible signs of hurricane damange. The beach didn't appear to have eroded much. We chose PDC in lieu of Cancun because we'd read the beaches weren't restored there yet. The at this hotel beach was superb. Palapas with lounge chairs were easy to get, even after a not so early breakfast. There wasn't a single day we arrived at the beach where there weren't at least two chairs available. The pool wasn't large, but plenty big for the number of people there. There was no jacuzzi or hot tub. There's no doubt this is the best section of beach north of the Cozumel ferry. We walked south all the way to the ferry and the beaches got worse the farther south you went. Playacar may be better. We didn't get that far. The property is not all-inclusive, but offers breakfast and halfboard (breakfast and dinner) options. We chose the breakfast only option. Don't miss it! It was a daily highlight. Fresh fruit, bread and pastries. This would be it for most places, but not here. There also was a european-style meat/cheese/yogurt spread plus several hot dishes like sausage, bacon, and potatoes. My highlight was the made to order omelet with fresh salsa (pico de gallo). Most days we didn't eat lunch. The two hour happy hour offers 2 for 1 drinks at the beach-side bar. The bar also serves food from the restaurants. There are a couple restaurants on site that serve dinner, but we only ate one dinner at the hotel, a beach-side buffet on evening. It was better than good, but I wouldn't rate it super. It was nice evening all the same getting to know some of the other guests. We sat with one couple from California and one from Switzerland. When you arrive they ask you what language you speak and seat you with a compatible group, another good deed. At night we took a short taxi ride to 5th Ave. for dinner and shopping. We highly recommend La Parilla and the Italian Restaurante de Bruno's. Overall though the staff made the biggest difference. They were all very friendly and helpful. By the end of the week most were addressing us by our last name. All had fun with playful comments to our son. The only problem we had was with our day trip to Xcel Ha. The travel agent didn't pick us up, so we were waiting in reception for over an hour. The staff said that it was a holiday and many non-regulars were on duty at the travel company, which probably resulted in the mix-up. They rebooked us for the following day. We loved Xcel Ha. Snorkeling with thousands of tropical fish was awesome, even saw a sting ray. One tip I would offer is to ask the taxi to take you to the Mega store on the way back from dinner. It's a Wal-Mart-like store just a couple blocks off 5th Ave. Stock up on drinks and snacks. Get more sunscreen or a mask and snorkel. Then hop a cab back to the hotel right from the store. There's a taxi stand right at the store. We found this place while looking for an ATM. The vanilla at the store was 1/5 the cost of that at the airport. I've posted a couple pictures here, but there are lots more from our trip on my flickr account <http://www.flickr.com/photos/jj_mac/sets/72057594115102823/>. I hope this helps. It's my first review posted here. Let me know what you think and how your experience compares.

Reviews.Title: “Playa's most beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: dbhurlbert
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Las Palapas for 6 nights, and could easily have stayed another week. The place is an oasis of tranquility in the midst of Playa's very active beach scene. I was lucky to get a beachfront bungalow (cabana) on what I consider, after three prior trips to the Maya Riviera, to be the loveliest beach in the region: pure white sand, sparkling pure water, and numerous palm trees (which nicely survived the recent hurricane). There were plenty of chaise lounges for everyone, nicely spaced under small thatched structures for shade. I was one of very few Americans there. Las Palapas evidently attracts Europeans, mostly. The hotel staff are able to communicate quite competently in Spanish, English, French and German! Everyone, from reception staff to bartenders to maids, were warm, gracious and efficient. After a couple days, the waiters, bartenders and front desk personnel greeted me by name. Although the hotel (really not a typical hotel, it's a collection of luxury bungalows) feels wonderfully isolated, it is only a 5-minute walk to Avenida 5, the town's pedestrian-only street lined with many shops and restaurants. I'm planning to return to Las Palapas in December, this time for two weeks.

HotelInfo.Name: Las Palapas Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Av. 34 Norte s/n | 5a Av. y Zona Federal Maritima, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
